191001.name: Busted
191001.description: Busted is a push-your-luck dice game played with eight dice. After each throw, one or more dice must be "locked" and the player can then choose whether to roll again or to bank any accumulated points. However, if a player eventually spells out “B-U-S-T-E-D“ on the dice, they lose any accumulated points for that hand. Players roll the dice for as long as they can to drive up their score toward the goal of 1000 points.

191003.description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of Chance cards: some are for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city:others give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Some famous names intervene to add interest.There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks, though the famous names can help with these.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn double or triple points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.

Bu harita resmi olmayan bir fan genişleme yapılmış. Wonder Semboller ve Grafik Copyright © 2004-2015 Gün, Inc. sadece ticari olmayan kullanım için Wonder Günleri izni ile üretilmiştir.

Bu özel kartları ve kuralları ile özel bir gemide oyun Ride temel Bilet ilkelerini izler. Oyunun amacı, çeşitli yolları seyahat ve diğer oyuncular outwitting tarafından en çok puan elde etmektir. Ya ABD ya da Avrupa baz oyunları tren parçaları ve tren kartları ihtiyacınız olacak (veya Wonder dükkandan Günleri onları satın alabilirsiniz. İsterseniz istasyonları kullanabilirsiniz.

Bazı değerine sahip her o kenti ziyaret ederek elde edeceği, şehirler içindir: Başkalarının size bilet tamamlamak için ekstra imkanlar vermek Şans kartları ekstra seti vardır. Bu kartlar dağıtılır / aynı miktarda ve aynı 'tutmak / atma' kuralları ile bilet alongwith toplanır. Geçiş sınırları ekstra attention.There yukarı-sonu oyun puanlama için 9 ikramiye de vardır gerektirir. Anti-terör cihaz kartları Suriye ve Irak'a seyahat için gerekli!

Bu sınırlı seçici seçenekleri olsa pansiyon, herhangi bir gri parça veya paralel parça yoktur.

Kurallara birçok yeni seçenek vardır: başında tüm kartları alışverişinde ama tüm yenilerini tutmak: 5 kartları atmak ve 5 yenilerini almak, sizde olduğu gibi: ikili ya da üçlü puan kazanmak: ve çok daha fazlası. Eğer isterseniz vagon stoku size bilet tamamlayarak diğer oyuncuları durdurma avantajı vererek, 3 ulaştığında da zaman çağırabilirsiniz.......
191003.name: Poland (Fan expansion of Ticket to Ride)

boardgamehonor.37703: 2016 Essener Feder Best Written Rules Winner

191004.description:
Travel to the past with Jonon and Jada, two stone age children, to rediscover how the first humans settled the world around them.

In My First Stone Age, a children's version of the Stone Age family game, the players collect goods and build their own settlement.
191004.name: My First Stone Age

191005.name: Calidar: Beyond the Skies
191005.description:
From the Kickstarter description:

2nd in the Calidar series, this 220+ pg compendium tells all about gods, their spirit servants, and their foes, for use with any RPG.

Second in the World of Calidar collection and for use with any RPG, this book unveils the gods of this fantasy universe. At its core lie the descriptions of pantheons for the main races and cultures of the Great Caldera, their individual deities, their mythologies, alliances, and foes. Each chapter reveals the history of the ancient peoples who summoned these gods into existence and established their cults. A significant part of this compendium details special powers mortal followers and priests can earn, based on the strengths of their piety. “Beyond the Skies” goes on to flesh out myriad servants of the gods, demons, demigods, divine cabals, the politics of pantheons and their internal rivalries, the bond between tribal shamans and Calidar’s World Soul, the spirit lords of the Dread Lands, secret societies and knightly orders among mortals, right down to death and what lies beyond. This book provides quite a lot of mechanical bits to enhance the game in addition to mythologies, secret plots, and the floor plans of temples and secret brotherhood lairs, each an invitation for encounters and adventures.

Much like those of ancient Greece, gods interact with mortals and epic heroes in game of chess reaching past nearby planets and outer planes. However powerful they are, they face a world of dangers including another universe whose monstrous deities seek to devour all: from the masses of mortals to their divine patrons. They will not relent until, perhaps, they gobble the World Souls themselves—the magical core and the source of life of the planets in Soltan’s ephemeris. As bleak as Calidar’s future may seem, the gods fear that their deaths aren’t the worst of fates. This aspect of their peril-fraught existence is one element contributing to the dynamics of this fantasy setting, as it directly affects the players’ heroes and the realms in which they go on adventuring. This compendium is crucial as it will influence all future titles published in this series.

191007.name: Gumshoe Zoom: Alchemy
191007.description:
From publisher blurb:

Chemistry or magic? Madness or miracles? Poison or power? Blend all those elements — and more — with Alchemy, the latest Zoom in on a historical magic system for GUMSHOE gaming. Operating at every level from the base dungeon-crawl to the Awakened Working, this magic system gives you the secrets of matter — and maybe a touch of mercury poisoning.

191008.name: SpyFi
191008.description:
"Publisher's Blurb"

SpyFi is a diceless, tabletop, freeform nanogame for 3 to 6 players. Includes three double-sided business card size and full page text of playsets: Agents provocateurs, Control and SHARQ.

191009.name: Home Bases
191009.description:
From the publisher's website:

Simple new mechanics for player characters who want a castle, tavern, sacred grove to call home and build stories around. Includes rules for the obligations that can make or break your base, examples to suit many different campaigns, and new magic items for characters who want to put down roots.

191010.name: The Waking Stones
191010.description:
From the publisher's website:

A megalith is just a set of standing stones—unless they’re actually members of an ancient stone race, reawakening in the 13th age! This full 13th Age Bestiary-style writeup has heroic, ambiguous, and villainous options that should fit into most any campaign.

191011.name: Untergrund (Cthulhus Ruf special issue - 2015)
191011.description:
(user summery)
This is a special issue of Cthulhus Ruf magazine, featuring the winners of the adventure contest Untergrund (Underground).
All three adventures are set for Cthulhu Now in an underground or otherwise claustropobic location.
1) Charlie's Game:
The crew of an oil rig is taken over by an ancient power. If the riddle is not solved in time, more than an environmental catastrophe will be at hand.
2) Die Schlucht:
Two people lost in a canyon somewhere in the desert. What happenend? Who will survive among heat, blood and shards?
3) Surok B-11
The bowels of earth have their own laws more often than not. But what a team of experts will find in a shut down russian mine will blow their minds.

191012.name: Plug & Play

videogamehonor.32089: 2015 IGF Awards (Nuovo) Best Innovation of the Year Nominee

191012.description: PLUG & PLAY is an award winning Short Film and Game for your digital device. Explore the feelings of anthropoid creatures that go beyond sexuality and reproduction: love. PLUG & PLAY is a surreal play with plugs.

191013.name: Plug & Play

videogamehwversion.296011: Jakks Pacific Plug It In & Play TV

191013.description:
A plug and play game is an interactive entertainment device designed for use on a television set that integrates the video game console with the game controller. The game software is built directly into the unit, which is typically designed to look like a toy or classic game console/controller with the addition of two AV ports. These systems usually contain either highly specialized games or activities, or a collection of classic games. Thus, it could be viewed as a video game console without interchangeable game software.

Although several manufacturers produced these devices before 2002, such systems became better known following the release of Jakks Pacific's Atari Classic 10-in-1 TV game. Most manufacturers have their own trademarked names for these systems, such as Radica's "Play TV" or Majesco's "TV Arcade"; however, most retailers refer to all of them as TV games or Plug & Play games.

Source: Wikipedia, "Handheld TV game", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

191014.name: A Fistful of Gun
191014.description:
Select one of eleven unique playable gunslingers and seek revenge as a lone wolf or with up to eight other bandits in local and online co-op. Master the specialized controls of each character, collect gold from fallen foes to purchase upgrades, and imbibe a bit of liquid courage and unleash a tornado of lead across the dusty plains.

Story Mode

When the evil railroad baron Clayton Boon decided to build a track to Hell, he didn’t reckon on a crazed shaman raising a posse of embittered psychopaths from the dead to stop him. Now they’ll pursue him across the whole Wild West, fighting their way through hordes of bandits, bears, braves and boogeymen just to find Boon and repay their debt.

Arcade Mode

Choose between eleven different gunslingers each with their own unique control scheme and methods of attack to master. Some characters require the finesse of a gamepad while others are strictly bound to mouse controls to mount their offensive.

Versus Mode

Square off against some of the most dangerous gunslingers this side of the Mississippi in the white-knuckled versus mode. Use each character's distinct advantage to cut down your opponent and use any item in the corral to gain the upper hand.

Online Mode

Gather a posse of up to nine other players in the chaotic online cooperative mode and battle across the wild plains for fame, glory, and bragging rights.

Source: The Game Website.

191015.name: Best of Music
191015.description:
Compete with your family or friends to see who has the biggest musical culture of yesterday and today.

Nostalgia and laughter guaranteed ! Young and old have their chance with nearly 1600 questions. Answer the questions of the cards and try to recognize visual album covers, complete an unforgettable words or recognize who owns accessories from famous ...

And without realizing it, you will sing on tubes that have marked you.

2-6 players or teams of players.

191016.name: Toto Temple Deluxe
191016.description:
Toto Temple Deluxe is a fast-paced, local-multiplayer party game in which players must steal an egg-laying goat from their friends and try to keep it on their own head for as long as possible. You know, normal stuff.

Pick your goat! Score loads of points in Classic mode, or blast everyone's face in Bomb mode! No friends around? No problem! The bots are here to save the day. Or the night. Whatever. Tired of losing? Team up with a skilled friend and savour your sweet, sweet revenge!

Source: The Game Website.

191017.name: Dice Mutants: Evolution Battle
191017.description:
Players are sentient dice that are evolving and battling at the same time.

Dice Mutants: Evolution Battle is a dice drafting game. At the beginning of a round, all the dice in the game are rolled and then players take turns claiming one of the available dice. The dice players draft are then assigned to improve their attack, defense, guile, mutation, and speed.

Every round, each Dice Mutant attacks every other Dice Mutant. Once a player has lost all their life points, they are out of the game. Last player left alive is the winner.

191019.name: Colonisation
191019.description:
Game Background:

You are the leader of a village in the forest of Na~TACE. Your expansion views require resources and pushes you to explore the surrounding areas.

Your lumberer will quickly discover areas for the development of agriculture for your farmers or mining for your blacksmith.

The wood harvested and will allow you to build farms, forges, fences or barracks for your soldiers.

But will your farmers and your hunter be able to provide enough food for your soldiers? No problem, send your merchant to other villages to share valuable resources.

Many other surprises await you in this game of resources gathering, war and colonization.

Finally, attack enemy villages to colonize the entire forest and win the game!

How to play:

The goal of the game is to eliminated other players by destroying their village with your soldiers.

24, 36 or 48 hexa cards (forests) are placed in a predetermined shape according to the number of players.
Each player choose a village and pick 3 ressources card.

Player 1 will advance his lumberer pawn forest by forest and discover 3 areas by flipping the forests he passes on. Underneath, he may discover a regular forest, a farm land, a mind land or a special land.

The lumberer will pick 3 wood cards and will use them to build farms (placing a pawn on the farm land), mines (placing a pawn on the mine land) or barracks (placing a pawn on the village).

For each farmer, the player will pick 1 farm card per farm land with a farmer. The food will be use to feed the soldiers (1 per barrack). Soldier pawns will be moved and advance to eventually attack the other villages or soldiers.

When a soldier or a group of soldiers attack, a D6 is used + all bonus cards the attacker player may have collect. Defense is fixed by the number of soldiers or what type of building is attacked + any defensive bonus the defendant player may have gathered.

191020.name: Fantasy 6 x 6 Tiles
191020.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a full-color, set of 6 inch by 6 inch, fantasy floor tiles with no overlay.

The PDF includes includes the VTT (Virtual Table Top Images for online play).

“Just a wine cellar? Sure. But I have heard the screams at night. There is more to that cellar than at first glance.”—The Butler

Fantasy Tiles includes six unique modular 6” x 6“ tiles with two doors that can be used to make a small dungeon in fantasy games.

Fantasy Tiles is intended for use in fantasy, horror, or medieval historical era games.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

What Lies Beneath: Attending a party at a rich noble’s mansion, the group enjoys a fully catered dinner, plenty of wine and ale, and entertainment. In a lull in the festivities or a trip to the bathroom, the butler tries to speak with one of the Player Characters in private. The butler wants them to investigate the wine cellar below. He says he hears screams at night when grabbing wine or ale from the cellar.

It’s up to the Player Character to tell the group and investigate or ignore the butler’s request.

As the party continues, more and more people start falling asleep as they consume more and more of the food and drink. Even the group starts to feel tired and sleepy. With each new slumbering guest, it becomes harder to slip away from the party.

Eventually even the group succumbs to unconsciousness…

191021.name: Ru-Marta
191021.description:
From publisher blurb:

The first free Filbar offering of 2016 is FT25 – Ru-Marta. This setting brings the players to a community with a jungle atmosphere. Based offshore the city of Ru-Marta is a trading depot and religious center. Several independent adventures are also available for those PCs needing just a little more experience points to level up!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for any number and level of adventurer(s) and DM. This adventure setting is easily adaptable to most any game and system.

191022.name: Lightspeed
191022.description:
From publisher blurb:

By the 31st Century, the Milky Way Galaxy has been mapped and explored by mankind using starships powered by the incredible warp space drive. This time of galactic exploration, conquest, and colonization is known as the Infinite Age. The Milky Way Galaxy is roughly 100,000 light years in diameter and contains roughly 200 billion star systems. The majority of these systems lie in the dense Core region. The Galaxy is divided into four equal quadrants: The Orion Quadrant, the Sagittarius Quadrant, the Centaurus Quadrant, and the Perseus Quadrant.

The Orion Quadrant is the home of the Sol System and Earth. The star systems around Earth were the first colonized and are now heavily populated Core Worlds. These colonies are still owned by the traditional governments of Earth such as the U.S., China, European Union, Japan and others. Collectively, these worlds and their governments are called the Old Earth Empires. They are constantly embroiled in petty wars and strife, but still maintain uneasy relations with both the Interstellar Federation and the Pan-Solar Empire.

The Perseus Quadrant is home to the Interstellar Federation. The Federation is a strong union of former colonies that have gained their independence from Earth. The government is a Republican Monarchy with a President being elected for life. For the most part, the Federation is benevolent and fair in their government and laws. Citizens of the Federation enjoy a high standard of living.

The tyrannical Pan-Solar Empire governs most of the Sagittarius Quadrant. The Empire, like the Federation, is also comprised of old colony worlds. Unlike the Federation, they did not gain their independence. Instead, the mad Emperor Gregor Veroveren, who has ruled his quadrant with an iron fist for more than 300 Solar Years, conquered them. The Worlds of the Empire have all been raped of their natural resources to fuel the huge military/industrial complex of the Imperial Armed Forces. Citizens of the Empire live in squalid misery with no human rights. They view the Federation with jealous eyes. It is the Empire's ultimate goal to conquer the Federation and take its wealth.

The Centaurus Quadrant is home to many new Federation colonies and countless small independent governments. It is on the edge of explored space and most of the new planets are being discovered there. For this reason, it is called the Frontier. The Centaurus Quadrant is home to pirates and bandits and is considered a wild area of space. Many independent freighters try their luck against both the Empire raids and bandit piracy to deliver goods back and forth between the colonies and the Federation and the Old Earth Empires.

In all, the Galaxy supports an estimated 4.9 trillion human inhabitants on over 150,000 worlds worlds, and expanding. Core worlds are heavily industrialized worlds with populations exceeding ten billion. These were some of the first worlds colonized during man's expansion into space. There are less than 1000 Core Worlds in the Galaxy. Core Worlds are usually not self-sufficient and rely on supplies and resources from the outer Colony Worlds. Colony Worlds are relatively recently discovered worlds that are self-sufficient in terms of population, but have difficulty producing high-end goods. Some Colony Worlds have been settled for over 400 years and are on the verge of becoming galactic powers in their own right. Recently colonized worlds on the Galactic Frontier are heavily dependent on other worlds for technology and supplies. Their populations usually number less than one million, often in the thousands.

Federation Rangers are tasked to enforce Federation law in the Galactic Frontier and on Federation Colonies and Associate Worlds. They have no jurisdiction on Federation member worlds. There, Federation AstroPol maintains bases for permanent law enforcement.

Lightspeed IF is a Role-Playing Game set in the Galaxy of the 31st Century, a period known in the Infinite Futures game system as the Infinite Age. This is a time of exploration and adventure. The conflicts of the Core Wars are over and the Galaxy is at peace, though old animosities simmer just below the surface and new rivalries threaten to flare into conflict. The galaxy of the Infinite Age is vast, and its possibilities are limitless.

Lightspeed IF is a campaign sourcebook for use with the Infinite Futures 2.0 core rulebook and the Pathfinder role-playing game.

191023.name: Tetris Ultimate
191023.description:
Source: The Publisher Website.

The world's most-lived puzzle game arrives on next-gen consoles, and is better than ever in Tetris Ultimate. With six exciting modes, fun new features, and unique visuals, the evolution of this iconic game is the ultimate must-have on next-gen consoles.

Experience the Best of Tetris in this fast-paced game of skills, you can take on the puzzle game solo, battle a friend, partner up with friends, or make battle teams. Up to four players can get in on the action.

191024.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 5, Issue 1 - Improper Channels)
191024.description:
From publisher blurb:

Packed full of great superhero fun, each issue will offer a short adventure, an NPC, or some game mechanics for the Heroes Wear Mask system. While compatible with the HWM system, you can always use the information presented in each issue for other superhero games—just monkey around with the stats and mechanics to fit the system you are using.

A great new adventure for Heroes Wear Masks.

191025.name: Goblin Magic
191025.description:
From publisher blurb:

Discover the Magic of the Goblins!

There are many different approaches to magic, and different groups are able to master it in different ways, creating strange and exotic spells that others would never dream of. Goblins are no different in this regard, and their strange magic, which ranges from tribal shamanism to a great way to make things go "boom," provides a number of potent spells for those who have a chance to learn them. While such secrets are rarely shared with outsiders, a number of these spells from the goblin warrens have been collected in this tome.

This book contains 18 new spells for a wide variety of spell lists, all of which are thematically linked to goblins, with a handful of spells devoted to their bugbear and hobgoblin cousins. Living in filth and squalor, some goblin shamans use eat disease/poison simply to have a safe meal, although they're sure to take advantage of the fact that they can transfer any disease or poison they ingest to their enemies with a touch. Transform your enemies into goblin dogs and ride them into battle with goblin dog transformation. Goblinruption transforms a single goblin into a potent explosive, unleashing a great kaboom in the event of its death. Whether you’re looking for unique and exciting spells for your goblin NPCs, or just want to expand your wizard’s ever-growing spellbook, the magic of goblins is not to be overlooked!

191026.name: Red Tide
191026.description:
From publisher blurb:

Red Tide claims to be a hero, but is in fact a wanted criminal. She is a mutant whose abilities manifested at puberty. Operating primarily in coastal areas, Red Tide prefers to target ‘big box’ stores, raiding them and distributing the stolen goods among local low-income citizens. She typically uses a stolen boat as her getaway vehicle. Though she sees herself as a "hero of the people", witnesses describe her as a cruel and power-hungry young thug.

"FOE FILE #05: RED TIDE" contains a briefing from TEACHER, the sentient computer system of the Crusader Citadel (headquarters of the Crusaders superhero team), character sheets with complete stats for Red Tide in VILLAINS AND VIGILANTESTM and LIVING LEGENDSTM, background, tactics, personality traits, choice dialogue and a printable Yacht counter in full color!

191027.name: The Usual Suspects (2008)
191027.description:
User summary:

The Usual Suspects combines some aspects of tabletop gaming with some aspects of a Parlor LARP to present a set scenario that is lightly randomized. Players take on established roles and attempt to determine the identify of a murderer, similar to the board game Clue. The randomization element allows the game to be reiterated with some novelty.

191028.name: Fate Weavers
191028.description:
User summary:

Characters in Fate Weavers are identified with one of four elements (Fire, Earth, Air, Water); this association influences nearly all aspects of subsequent play. Each element corresponds to a trait (Physical, Resistance, Personality, and Mental, respectively) and determines how a character will, principally, interact with the world. Attributes have numeric values distributed from a point pool.

The game proposes an interesting phase mechanic where the setting ("the universe") transitions between the elements; characters can take advantage of these phases to influence their fates.

191029.name: Sovereign Player's Guide
191029.description:
From the introduction:

The Sovereign Player's Guide provides rules for creating a character and establishes the players' view of the setting. Because all characters are devoted to a single political power center, establishing the setting and the players' role in it is atypically important. Note the Sovereign Gamemaster's Guide presents a slightly different view of the setting.

191030.name: Sovereign Gamemaster's Guide
191030.description:
From the introduction:

The Sovereign Gamemaster's Guide presents rules for sorcery (players cannot use sorcery) as well as a slightly alternate version of the setting and the world history from that presented in the Sovereign Player's Guide. In addition, it includes general guidelines for running the game.

191031.name: Sovereign Character Sheet
191031.description:
User summary:

The Sovereign character sheet presents a unified layout for tracking game characters. Notably, it includes the "Oath of the Sovereign" which is the guiding statement of character motivation within the game.

191032.description:
Invasion 1066: Stamford Bridge is the second game in the Invasion 1066 series designed by Norm Smith. Originally published as Orri's Storm by Saxon Games, we have enhanced this great design by developing the rule set even further and providing new artwork by industry veteran Charles Kibler.

Just days after defeating an English army at Gate Fulford, Harald Hardrada, the Viking warrior king is caught by surprise at Stamford Bridge by a second English army.

Map scale is 50 meters per hex and the units vary in size from 100 to 250 men. The game is quick-playing and bloody with easy to understand mechanics. Historical touches such as berserker rage, Orri's storm, viking shield wall, army morale by troop type, leader loss, and arrow supply; it is all here in a very easy to play package.
191032.name: Invasion 1066: Stamford Bridge

191035.name: Gamer's Handbook of the Gulf Coast Avengers
191035.description:
From the Back of the Book:

The Gamer’s Handbook of the MARVEL UNIVERSE is the complete, last word on the heroes, villains, and other characters of the Marvel Universe that the players of the MARVEL SUPER HEROES role-playing game have been looking for! Supplemented by data from the popular OFFICIAL HANDBOOK OF THE MARVEL UNIVERSE, the Gamer’s Handbook of the MARVEL UNIVERSE has complete MARVEL SUPER HEROES game statistics for hundreds of Marvel characters – the good, the bad, and the in-between!

The pages of the Gamer’s Handbook of the MARVEL UNIVERSE are designed to be removed from the book for easy play. The pages are five-hole punched so they can be organized in a binder. And each page includes complete background information, important facts, and complete stats – everything you need!

This volume of the Gamer’s Handbook of the MARVEL UNIVERSE covers the heroes, allies, and villains of the newest branch of the Avengers – the GULF COAST AVENGERS! In it you will find returning heroes like Captain Marvel, Force, and Firebird; new heroes like Pig Iron and Longhorn; and new villains such as the immortal sorcerer Aleister Crowley and the armored Bulwark.

191036.name: Gulf Coast Avengers Sourcebook
191036.description:
User Summary:

Sourcebook describing the world of the Gulf Coast Avengers, a branch of the Avengers responsible for the Gulf Coast of the United States, as well as Central and South America. This book also describes locations, countries, groups/organizations, and vehicles. Included in the book is an entire chapter on the Crescent City - New Orleans of the Marvel Universe.

Characters in the Gulf Coast Avengers are described in the Gamers Handbook to the Gulf Coast Avengers.

191037.name: Dodge the Dino
191037.description:
From the box cover: "Collect the eggs - but watch out for the crazy dino!"

From the publisher's web site:
"A fantastic educational game from the multi-award winning Chimp and Zee range of games and puzzles. Each player races to collect Dinosaur eggs from the Dino's den on the rock, whilst trying to avoid the tail of the revolving dinosaur; which can knock all the eggs away. The player who has collected the most eggs wins the game. If there is a tie - the player with the most brown eggs wins.

Dodge the Dino is great fun for children and easy for parents to explain. The game can help your child learn through play. Easy to set up you can start playing in just a few minutes and everyone has a chance to win. Only takes ten minutes to play and is even great fun when it's not your turn. Dodge the Dino was created to help children with colours, shapes, matching, and co-ordination along with developing the ability to play together. The game is presented in a quality cardboard carton complete with carry-handle and glitter printing."

191038.description:
In the late Middle Ages, the Canary Islands had faded into obscurity from a European point of view. There was neither gold nor silver, and the islands did not play a role as a trading post because the north-south trade of that time went through the Sahara.

In 1312, the Genoese merchant and seafarer Lancelotto Malocello effectively "rediscovered" the Canary Islands. During the 15th century, the archipelago was conquered by the Spanish. Spanish masters pushed agriculture, cultivating sugar cane, wine and grain, which quickly gave the islands a certain economic value and importance.

In West of Africa, the players cultivate goods, try to sell them profitably, and build settlements. Each player has their own deck of cards. Each turn the players select cards from their decks to conduct successful actions, always keeping the actions of the other players in mind.
191038.name: West of Africa

191039.name: Claymore (Volume 2, Issue 3, 1994)
191039.description: This issue contains two RPG scenarios, random encounters and equipment lists for variable RPGs. Included is also a great dice test article and news and reviews of the RPG scene in -93.

191040.name: 20 Celestial Feats
191040.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wield the purifying flames of the celestial heavens! Inside this edition of Feats of Legend is 20 new celestial themed feats. These feats are designed for use with any character looking to use the powers of the upper planes, be them celestial-blooded sorcerers, aasimar, clerics or paladins.

191041.description:
Carrot supplies are getting low and the rabbits must brave the wilds to collect enough to feed the colony! Time is short, the pathways long and the birds are circling overhead, looking for easy prey.

Carrotia is a light co-operative, tile placement game for 1-6 players where the team collectively works together against a timer to build three different mazes of increasing size. The master rabbit needs to dash from entrance to the exit within a specific number of moves according to the current mission card, scooping up the precious carrots while avoiding the owl, hawk and other birds as they swoop low over the zones causing mayhem and mischief.

Although the task may seem daunting, the master rabbit has some supporters, other rabbits that bring a unique special ability to assist the team and and thwart the hungry predators!
191041.name: Carrotia

191042.name: Apocalyptia Field Manual
191042.description:
From the introduction:

Apocalyptia is an independent tabletop role-playing game set after The End. There are a dozen ways society might have fallen. What matters now is forming a Team and staying alive. This is a game about facing moral dilemmas while building a new world out of the rubble of the old. Survival has a heavy price. What is right? What is wrong? What is it worth? Where do you draw the line? And what will you be after you have had to answer these questions for yourself?

191043.description:
It is time to polish your armor and sharpen your sword, for mighty Caesar has called for his legions to assemble.

The Cohort is a fast-paced card game for 2-6 players in a race to be the first to assemble a Legion and show Caesar you are the greatest of his commanders.

Legions are composed of 3 different Cohorts, each made of one of seven different types of units: Praetorians, Catapults, Centurions, Sagittarii, Equites, Legionaries and Velites. During a turn, you draw two cards, keep one and give the other to a player of your choice. You can keep that card in your hand or trigger it and create a Cohort. Be careful though, for the troops are rowdy! Until a Cohort is complete their behaviour works against you.

So snap them into line as quickly as you can, disrupt the plans of your fellow commanders and show Caesar that your Legion is the greatest in all the Empire.
191043.name: The Cohort

191045.name: Lord of Magna: Maiden Heaven
191045.description:
The game's battle system is similar to the battle system found in Valkyria Chronicles.It features turn-based battles, with character order based on individual speed. The parties are assembled within a deck and controls in battle have been compared to those of an action game. The special attacks of the characters are unlocked based on their trust in Lux, the game's protagonist, and by defeating enemies more special moves can be used.

Source: Wikipedia, "Lord of Magna: Maiden Heaven", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

191046.name: Spooky Steps
191046.description:
Excellent fun and educational game of chance for young kids, equally fun for adults. A witch has turned the players into frogs and they must race through her lair to find a cure (cure is a cauldron spinner which will either leave you as a frog or transform you back to human form).

The movement mechanic is where this game shines. 54 cardboard tiles (6 ghosts, 6 spiders, 42 footsteps with 1, 2 or 3 steps each) are used as a movement pool. To move players can turn over as many cards as they wish but try to avoid the ghosts and spiders. Players movement is equal to the number of footsteps they turn over. If they flip a ghost they must move backwards. Spiders stop you in your tracks.

191047.name: Rayman Rush
191047.description:
Back of the case:

Auf in den Wettkampf! Das einzigartige Rayman Multiplayer-Spiel kann beginnen.
[...]
Über 12 Rennstrecken fordern Dich heraus. Benutze Feuerfässer, Laserkanonnen, Zugbrücken oder nehme geheime Wege, um schneller ans Zierl zu kommen.
[...]

191048.description:
The realm is strife with conflict as armies of Humans and Dwarves battle against the swarms of Goblins and Undead. The Barbarian Horde, a neutral 5th army may also enter the fray to fight for either side.

Player's will build large armies, multiple cities, and infrastructure which will help boost their economy and fuel their war machine. Also, each army has four heroes that can be used to explore dungeons, fight monsters, gain valuable treasure and ultimately advance levels in an attempt to lead their armies to victory. Each faction has unique units, spells, heroes, and upgrades at their disposal. It is only through the careful balance of limited resources that can win the day. There are many paths to victory. The struggle is real. The carnage is devastating. The conquest has begun!

Conquest and Carnage are the next in the line of the Warparty series. Lock'n Load Publishing will not be publishing this game. You can find the first game Warparty series at the link below.

https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/94255/warparty/ratings?c...
191048.name: Conquest and Carnage

191049.description:
To bring the best youngsters into the business, the smuggler boss is holding a contest, with the candidates being challenged to move a sack filled with contraband through an opening in the fence.

More specifically, in Smugglers players form the "sacks" used for smuggling out of modeling clay and hide their contraband within. The sacks are then rolled down a 3D path, with a die roll determining which hole in the fence the player needs to try to squeeze through. The player whose bag fits through the hole and who has the largest sack now checks the smaller bags, possibly taking the contraband hidden within. Who will prove to be the best smuggler?
191049.name: Smugglers

191050.name: Weapons of Rock and Roll
191050.description:
From publisher blurb:

Two of Otherverse Game’s signature settings encompass music in a big way, and the rest can be as rocking as the game master wants.

Heavy Future’s all about the power of rock n’ roll, and tearing up the 46th Century in a airbrushed space cruiser blasting heavy metal. Black Tokyo encompasses everything anime, so idol singers and magical girls with a gift for song and dance and military-grade moe are perfectly valid character options. And hey, if you want to have an activist post-human weaponize protest rock at a clinic defense rally in the Otherverse America campaign setting, go for it. And over in the Psi-Watch campaign setting, metal head superheroes might balance concert tour dates with black ops.

With all that in mind, sometimes music itself can be a weapon. This short sourcebook introduces Musical and Superior Musical Weapons- high tech or technomagical sound-based weapons that are especially deadly in the hands of a skilled performer. This sourcebook primarily focuses on Musical Weapons and related content for the Heavy Future campaign setting, but there’s plenty usable in this sourcebook for Black Tokyo, not to mention of plenty of content usable in either world.

191051.description:
Outlive is a management/survival game in a post-apocalyptic universe in which nature has overcome its rights amongst the world of Men. In Outlive, players have six days (turns) to send heroes gathering resources during the day, while avoiding threats from other players and reinforce their settlements during the night, trying to recruit new survivors and adapt to the new world. The specificities: movements and resource gathering are compelled by you heroes strength.

You play six rounds (six days) that are divided between the day phase and the night phase. During the day phase, you move your four heroes of different strength on the board to collect resources with a mechanical movement innovative and interactive.

During the night phase, you manage your shelter, feed your survivors and recruit new ones, organize your survival, and improve your rooms and objects.

Only one clan can outlive this devastated world!
191051.name: Outlive

191052.name: Kommentakerfið
191052.description: Players take turns playing the editor who reveals a headline and the other players select a comment card that they think is funny in the context. The editor selects the one he thinks is the funniest and that player gets a point.

191053.name: Under Both Flags: The American Navy in the Civil War
191053.description: Rules for American Civil War naval battles in miniature. Scaled for 1/600 miniatures, but easily adaptable to other scales. Tactical level, 1 turn = approximately 3 minutes, with one miniature = one vessel. Includes historical and "what if" scenarios, as well as charts for most vessels in action during the ACW.

191054.description:
Promotional Expansion for Xenoshyft: Onslaught.

Cards:
"Hades' Gaze" Plasma Launcher × 4
Prototype "Medusa" Gun Emplacement × 4
XNC "Inferno" Grenade × 4
RDM "Corpseman" Doc Bot × 4
Experimental APS "Flashbang" Armor × 4
Experimental XMP "Atlas" Armor × 4
Munitions Expert Nicholas Colt × 4
Chief Armorer Mark Gatling × 4
Medical Officer Selena Garand × 4
Research Engineer Joseph Nagant × 4
Eleventh Hour Setup × 2
191054.name: XenoShyft: Onslaught – Game Night Kit #1

191055.name: Kerala
191055.description:
Welcome to the elephant festival in the Indian province of Kerala! Colorfully decorated elephants roam everywhere, and naturally players want to participate and make the most magnificent fairground with as many elephants as possible.

In Kerala, each player wants to take at least one tile of each color, and all tiles of one color should be joined together, but of course the players are constantly getting in the way of one another and grabbing the tiles that someone else wants.

191056.name: Connis erste Spiele
191056.description: Connis erste Spiele is a collection of four introductory board games for youngsters: a memory game, a cooperative tile game, and two classic game designs.

191057.description: The Halt mal kurz: Das Känguru-Spiel, based on Marc-Uwe Kling's kangaroo trilogy, the rules of the game are explained by the marsupial himself in a new story. In the game, players must annoy the other players as skillfully as they can through assemblies, not-to-do lists, epic Schnick-Schnack-Schnuck groups, and (of course) the hated Razupaltuff card.
191057.name: Halt mal kurz: Das Känguru-Spiel

191058.name: Die drei !!!: Geheimnis der alten Villa
191058.description: In the cooperative dice game Die drei !!!: Geheimnis der alten Villa, the players help Kim, Franzi and Marie to unravel the mystery of the old mansion, finding the precious diamonds hidden within before time runs out and Antoine the master thief makes off with the gems on his own.

191059.name: Ubongo Junior Mitbringspiel
191059.description: Ubongo Junior Mitbringspiel is a travel-sized version Ubongo Junior, with all players competing at the same time each round to place all of the animals on their board as quickly as possible. Whoever calls "Ubongo!" first keeps the card as a reward, and whoever ends up with the most cards wins! Two difficulty levels are included to help balance the challenge between skilled and novice players.

191060.name: Was ist Was: Fußball
191060.description:
How do football players train, what equipment is needed, and what is a challenge? Was ist Was: Fußball includes ten thematic cards showing football-related training, equipment, and tasks, and during play players will need to find matching motif cards to score.

Was ist Was: Fußball includes a child-oriented manual about football for those who want to know more about the sport.

191061.name: Scout: Mein erstes Taschengeld
191061.description: Today the kids have money to spend once again, and in Scout: Mein erstes Taschengeld the players decide for themselves how to spend their money and what to save. Whoever wisely divides up their money, compares prices, earns coins on their own, and feeds their piggy bank wins!

191062.name: Europa
191062.description:
Europa features gameplay similar to Deutschland: Finden Sie Minden, another Günter Burkhardt design, with players trying to locate places or landmarks on a map, but this time instead of searching for things in Germany players will have all of Europe lying before them.

To set up, players lay out the game board, which features Europe with no place names on it. On a turn, players are confronted with a location, such as the Aletsch Glacier or the Kola Peninsula, then they all try to guess where in Europa that location is. They can play it safe and choose a large block of land – scoring only a few points in the process if correct – or they can go small and pinpoint the location more precisely on one of the game boards, scoring far more points if correct, but upping their chances of scoring nothing if they miss their mark. In the end, whoever scores the most points wins.

191063.description:
Rocky Beach is haunted, with ghostly figures suddenly appearing everywhere!

It's time for a ghost hunt in Die drei ??? Kids: Gespensterjagd, with Justus, Peter and Bob getting in disguise (thanks to the players covering them with cards) to look as creepy as possible. But the ghosts reappear repeatedly and keep getting in the players' way. Be bold with your searching, but try not to take too many risks as you together work to put an end to the specters.
191063.name: Die drei ??? Kids: Gespensterjagd

191064.name: 5th Edition Translation for Ponyfinder

rpgseries.36489: The Open Gaming Store Free RPG Day 2016

191064.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the 5th edition translation of Ponyfinder. This text assumes that you already own Ponyfinder, so much of the fluff and lore is truncated in favor of the rules you need translated to use the setting and races with 5th edition rules.

191065.description:
Quick! Into the old stone castle!

An exciting race for the Magic Cup is about to start in Burg Flatterstein, but beware as the mysterious ruins are littered with obstacles and odd surprises. With a little luck and some skill with flapping bats to the right places, children will find the fastest route to their destination.

Players take turns using the "catapult" to launch cloth bats at the game board. Depending on where the bat lands, the active player may move 1-2 spaces. If they land in the moat, they must take a Ghost card. The Ghost cards have various effects that can either help the player, or hinder their progress. The first player that is able to get to the top of the castle wins the game, and gets the golden bat trophy!
191065.name: Castle Flutterstone

191066.name: World of Xantus
191066.description:
From the introduction:

It is the Year 204 After Abduction, and the humans on Xantus number about 5,000. They all live in a partially underground structure called the Den, built from part of Ship, which is still controlled by a sapient but usually uncommunicative computer, also called Ship. The player characters must use good old human ingenuity, the products of backengineered alien technology, and special abilities called “Flukes,” which have evolved in response to the alien microbes and extreme evolutionary pressures suffered by the generations since capture, to explore Xantus, defend the inhabitants of Den, and try to divine the nature of the Abductors and why they brought humans to Xantus.

User summary:

The game document includes the game rules, the distinctive campaign setting, and an introductory adventure.

191067.name: Zock 'n' Roll
191067.description:
The dice dance across the table in Zock 'n' Roll, and every player must ask themselves: Should I get out and be satisfied with a little success, or do I stick with it even though I might end up empty-handed?

A good poker face is required because every player keeps three dice hidden for themselves, and they get to add the result of those dice to what's thrown face-up for all to see, thereby adding additional uncertainty and stress. If you can pinch players in the early rounds, whoever stays in the longest can skim off the cream for themselves...

191068.name: Truth, Inc.
191068.description:
User summary:

Typographical errors and profanity abound in this cyberpunk rule book. The game presents a fairly typical cyberpunk "dystopian" setting, dominated by a single massive corporation, mated to basic rules.

191069.name: Robert D. Anderson & The Legacy of Cthulhu
191069.description:
Features:
- Thrilling storyline based upon H.P. Lovecraft's ideas and set in Bavaria 1940
- Playable novel with 15 unique chapters, ranging from castles & dungeons to lost worlds in space
- 12 weapons: Pistols, rifles, German secret weapons of WWII, alien technology, destructive spells of the Great Old Ones
- 4 multiplayer arenas for up to 8 players
- Huge Bonus Pack
- Made by fans of the Cthulhu myth for fans of the Cthulhu myth.
- Cutscenes, directed by Gerhard Daurer, award-winning director and author of "Game of Life."
- Exclusive soundtrack contributed by Europeans Dark Wave / Goth / Ambient / EBM scene.
- Comes with dozens of exclusive Artworks from Peter "Project: Strom" Siedl and five totally new short stories based upon H.P. Lovecraft.

Back of the Game Box

191070.description:
At first glance, a visit to Dream Islands might seem like haphazard island hopping. The tourists, however, are moving from island to island based on the tactical considerations of the players, who each have three goals in mind based on their order cards. One such card might require the assembling of vacationers on one or several atolls, while another calls for a majority presence on an island.

Thus, in Dream Islands players must tactically budget their movement points in order to send the tourists where they need them to go.
191070.name: Dream Islands

191071.name: Skull King: Das Würfelspiel
191071.description: In Skull King: Das Würfelspiel, the player pirates try to predict the results of the dice battles, and whoever predicts most accurately will come out the winner of the contest.

191072.name: Star Master
191072.description:
Memory game played with dice.
Studied to be able to help the Alzheimer patients.

Content :
1 game board -9 coloured cubes -2 dice -54 coloured pegs (6 of each colour).

Object of the game :
Memorize the placement of nine coloured cubes, and after turning them face down, retrieve them. The winner is the first to get 6 coloured pegs in his scoring row.

Beginning of the game :
Place the nine cubes colour side up. You have one minutes to memorize each one’s location before turning them face down. The youngest player starts by rolling both dice, then play continue clockwise.

Rules of play :
The white die indicates the colour the player has to find, if it shows a star the player may choose the colour to find. He then turn over one of the cubes.

-If it is the right colour, the player puts one peg of the same colour in his scoring row, he then put back the cube but switching its location with another cube and without looking at the colour of the other cube. Then he gives the dice to the player to his left.

-If its not the right colour, he simply put the cube back in place and gives the dices to the player to his left.

Play continue until one plyer has filled the six spaces in his score row.

The black die :
If ithe black die shows a star and the white die shows a colour, all players may look for the corresponding cube. The fastest player to put his finger on a cube then turn it face up, if it is the right colour, he wins a coloured peg and play continues as normal. If it is not the right colour he loses a peg of that colour if he has one in his score raw, and play resumes as normal.

If a player wins a peg of a colour that is no longer available he may steal if from one of the other players scoring row.


The black die is not recommended when playing with children under the age of 7.

191073.description:
The gray morning has arrived, and the vampires of the ancient clans must now hurry back to their tombs. For the high and mighty this is easy, but the smaller, weaker vampires have the strength to do this only in groups. Thus, you as the vampire lord might want to play out several with low values together in order not to be surpassed.

Whatever you do in Vampire Queen, though, be sure to rid yourself of the intrusive vampire hunter because no one wants to get stuck with that!
191073.name: Vampire Queen

191074.name: Stadt Land Fluss Extreme
191074.description: In Stadt Land Fluss Extreme, everyone plays at the same time to try to find nine terms that apply to each of two categories within two minutes.

191075.name: Qwirkle: Erweiterung 2
191075.description: Qwirkle Erweiterung 2 has six small expansions in a single box, with the expansions making use of six action tokens that can be added to the Qwirkle base game for new, richly varied gameplay.

191076.name: DONK!
191076.description:
DONK! - the Samurai Duck, the computer game, was created by THE HIDDEN and released in 1993 on the Amiga / Amiga CD32 games console. In this 20th anniversary commemorative card game, Donk has to tackle 7 Zones in his arch enemy Eider Down's world (Con-Struct, Electro Moss, Hab, Hanic, Plasma, Rock, and Subaqua), seeking the Gems that unlock the Zones, destroy Eider Down's Fortress, and defeat Eider Down himself!

Each Zone is represented by a separate deck of cards. To complete a Zone, Donk must work his way through the deck, turning over cards which could be Enemies to defeat (by spending Spin Power or using Power Ups), Hazards to avoid (by using Power Ups), various Devices such as the Map (to reveal the next few cards and jump ahead), Teleport (to jump to another Zone), Blocks and Switches that can hinder or help progress. Ultimately, Donk needs to find the Gem card within the Zone deck that unlocks the Zone, and then get to the Exit card to complete the Zone.

Each time a Zone is completed, Donk will get a chance to attack the Fortress / Eider Down by spending what Spin Power they have left if it is enough. If all Zones are completed, and Donk has enough Spin Power left, they could get the chance to defeat Eider Down in the Final Battle!

Donk! can be played in 1 player mode, as a solitaire card game, or in 2 player mode where Donk and his fighting partner Judo Juggs team up (sharing Power Ups) / or go head to head to complete Zones and defeat Eider Down.

191077.name: Gierki Małżeńskie
191077.description:
This board game has been published together with two other polish games "Korporacja and "Kariera Polityczna" in a series of games illustrated by famous cartoonist Andrzej Mleczko. All three titles are lightweight party games with simple mechanics accompanied by amusing cartoons.

In Gierki Małżeńskie, which roughly translates to "Marriage Games" players play in pairs (1-4 couples) and solve multiple challenges presented on cards. There are four types of cards:

Guessing what a partner would do in a given situation (i.e. who knows their partner the best)
Charades
Describing a given word without using a few other specified words
General knowledge questions




It is possible to play with multiple couples (up to four) - in such case couples compete with each other. There is also a one couple variant in which partners compete against each other.

191078.name: DragonHeist
191078.description:
In DragonHeist, 2 to 4 players are gold thieves, taking it in turns to plunder the sleeping dragon's hoard, pushing their luck to grab the most treasure, whilst trying not to wake the dragon!
Once all the coins from the hoard have been stolen, the player with the most treasure wins!

TREASURES!
Players roll 6 'Plunder Dice' to see what treasures they can collect - coins, keys, chests, or magic rings. If they finish their turn with any of these treasures they can claim them from the dragon's hoard. There are 3 magic rings to find that can protect players from dragonfire, silence their noise, or make them invisible!

THE DRAGON FIGHTS BACK!
Some dice rolled affect treasures – the dragon can snatch them back, or they can be made too hot to hold by dragonfire. The dragon's tail or wing send coins flying around his lair, whilst rolling a dragon's eye means the dragon is starting to wake up, so best not roll any noise!

DEFEATING THE DRAGON!
If a player manages to collect all 3 magic rings, and they are brave enough, they can try to defeat the dragon! With all 3 magic rings, they cannot be seen or heard, and are protected from dragonfire! The 'Dragon Die' is rolled to see whether the player can defeat the dragon before all their gold is stolen back

191079.description:
This expansion to the QUBQST base game adds characters, creatures, catacombs and more magic items to the game.

QUBQST (cubequest) is a dice rolling, dungeon crawling game, that takes classic elements from early fantasy role-playing games, and mixes them with simple to pick up gameplay, and retro computer game style graphics!

QUBQST plays like a casual computer game - generate your catacombs, take your party of characters through, encountering creatures, traps, secret rooms, items and treasures, until you reach the Golden Cube, your final destination in the catacombs!

Only by defeating all of the creatures on the Golden Cube, can the party win, calculate their score, and see how they rank - will they be Hopeless Heroes, Average Adventurers, or Catacomb Conquerors?!
191079.name: QUBQST: Expansion One

191080.name: SOURCES
191080.description:
In this ultimate battle card game, powerful SOURCE wizards face each other in a spell casting show down! Two to four players move around the play area, made up of hidden Spell Cards, collecting and combining sets of cards to make powerful spells to unleash on the other wizards! The aim of SOURCES is simply to defeat your opponents - the last wizard standing wins!

Spell Cards come in four types, representing the power Source for each wizard – Fire (red), Earth (green), Water (blue) and Air (yellow). In each of these four Sources there are seven spell types (Molten Rock, Fist of Air, Acid Spray, Cone of Cold, The Orb, Sound Wave and Concussion Bolt). Combining these together in sets of one Source, or one spell type (eg. Molten Rock), creates spells that cause damage. Even more powerful spells can be made by combining specific sets of spell types in one Source colour.

Players start with 20 Life (indicated by a d20), a hand of four Spell Cards, and the play area is laid as a 4 X 4 grid of Spell Cards that start face down, with the remainder of the Spell Cards set aside as a draw pile.

Each turn, players can perform a number of different actions once each:
- Take a Spell Card from the draw pile if they have a hand of fewer than four
- Move their wizard avatar from one Spell Card in the play area to another adjacent card

Reveal the Spell Card their avatar is on, choosing whether to trade this with one in their hand or not (either way a Spell Card has to be replaced back in the play area)
Attack another player by discarding a set of three Spell Cards. There are three types of attacks:




1- Source attacks - three Spell Cards from the same Source colour, this type of attack only does 2 damage
2- Basic spell attack - three Spell Cards of the same spell type (eg. Molten Rock) from any of the four Source colours, doing the damage indicated by the spell type (1 to 7 damage)
3- Advanced spell attacks - each Spell Card has a combination attack written on it, consisting of three different spell types (all in the same Source colour). These attacks are the hardest to collect, and do the most damage (8 to 12 damage).

191081.description:
In Schnapp den Sack, Zacki the sack awaits in the middle of the table. Shuffle the deck of sack cards, which contains four types of sacks with 1-5 sacks on each card, then distribute the cards evenly among all players.

On a turn, flip the top card of your stack, then place it in the proper row of cards leading away from Zacki, with each type of sack getting its own row. If placing this card would make the sum of sacks in the row equal six, the first player to grab Zacki takes these cards; if the card would make the row go over six, then it's placed in a different row; if the player grabs the sack by mistake, they must place one card that they previously collected under their deck.

Once all the cards have been played and claimed by players, the game ends and whoever has collected the most cards wins!
191081.name: Schnapp den Sack

191086.name: Samsung Gear VR
191086.description:
Samsung Gear VR is a mobile virtual reality device developed by Samsung Electronics in collaboration with Oculus VR. A compatible Samsung Galaxy device (Galaxy Note 5 or Galaxy S6/S6 Edge), sold separately, acts as the headset's display and processor, while the Gear VR unit itself contains the high field of view lenses as well as a custom IMU for rotational tracking which connects to the smartphone via micro-USB.

The Gear VR headset also includes a touchpad and back button on the side, as well as a proximity sensor to detect when the headset is on. The touchpad and button allow for a standard minimum input capability for users to interact with the virtual environments, whereas Google Cardboard devices only feature a button.

Source: Wikipedia, "Samsung Gear VR", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

191087.name: Boinnnggg
191087.description:
In Boinnnggg, each player is rolling dice to move their four plastic discs around the board onto either frog or flower spaces. When a flower space is reached, a player attempts to flick the disc onto a central flower-themed tower. Landing a piece on the top level or middle level will earn points, while landing directly under the flower will earn no points.

Play continues until the first player has landed all four of their discs onto or under the tower, with the winner being the player who scored the highest number of points.

From the back of the box:
"Frogs hop around this quiet pond, until one all of a sudden attempts to jump to the big central flower. Try to get all your frogs onto the flower in the middle but watch out, the first to get there does not necessarily win the game!"

191088.name: Null Singularity

rpg.10737: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

191088.description:
From publisher's website:

NULL SINGULARITY is a DCC RPG- compatible, existential, space-horror-and-survival one-shot.

In NULL SINGULARITY, players take on the role of Voidants, 70s-eras space travellers who left the Earth to flee from the Null Singularity – an apocalyptic entity that is, at once, a massive black hole and a “long-dark night of the soul.” For an unknown period of time – decades or even centuries – the Voidants of the Alektryon mission have played hide-and-seek with the Null Singularity across the cosmos, but today is the day it has caught up with them… or has it?

NULL SINGULARITY plays “vignette style” in 3-5 hours making it a perfect one-shot for your regular gaming group as well as an excellent choice to GM as an event at your favorite gaming convention.

191089.name: Pixel Tactics: Smasher / Paul Peterson
191089.description:
Pixel Tactics promo card.

Card text: When the game begins, draw one card, then select two cards from your Hand and remove them from play. This Leader gains both of those cards' Leader Abilities.

191090.name: Pixel Tactics: Princess / Princess Annette
191090.description:
Pixel Tactics promo card.

Card text: Draw a card at the start of each of your Turns. At the end of each Turn after Ceasfire, discard until you have one card in Hand. The first time you Recruit, play an Order, place a Trap, or play an Operation each Turn is a Free Action.

191091.name: Pure Hold'Em
191091.description:
Pure Hold'em is the latest edition of hyper-real gaming expriences from indie developers VooFoo Studios.

Step inside the Pure Casino, where playing big means winning big. Split across 4 different tables, each requiring more skill and determination than the last, Pure Hold’em brings all the excitement of the casino to the convenience of the couch.

Starting at the Joker table on the floor of the vibrant casino; those who are top of their game can work their way up to the esteemed Aces and Masters tables in the VIP penthouse. If Lady Luck is on your side, you could win big and get the chance to enter a higher level table. The higher the player goes, the higher the stakes and the bigger the pot.

Source: The Publisher Website.

191092.name: Brainbox: Kaatje
191092.description: Brainbox: Kaatje is a version of Brainbox specifically made for the Belgian/Dutch market. Kaatje is a popular television figure for small children. As with all Brainbox games the players are shown a card with a drawning and have to memorize all aspects as later they will be asked a specific question about it.

191093.name: Excavator Monthly (Issue 4)

rpgissuearticle.170422: Articles: Making Coffee for the real Road Warrior: Mel Gibson

191093.description:
From the Publisher's website:

What drives your character? Why risk life and limb in the God forsaken ruins and wastelands of The Mutant Epoch? In issue 4 we offer 50 goals and obsessions to motivate your post apocalyptic character, and much more.

EM-4 includes articles on how many adversaries a GM should throw at PCs, dice rolling methods to speed up game pace, creating handouts along with links to a heap of free sheets, the bonus offer method of character generation, more NPCs, wicked relics: Grenade Mat and Laser tipped bullets, plus three freaky creatures: the Waste Grazer, Pus Worm and Hackoid. Articles on the causes of PA factional warfare, agreed upon rendezvous, making coffee for Mel Gibson, and a new skill: Acrobatics, round out this content rich publication. Get it in PDF or print today Excavator Monthly is the official magazine for The Mutant Epoch milieu, covering the TME RPG, fiction, art and more. Not using the Outland System? No worries, there is a ton here that any post apocalyptic GM can utilize. How do your post-apocalyptic heroes know each other?

This issue includes:

Creating Intriguing Handouts with 17+ free to download player hand out sheets 50 PC Goals, Drives and Obsessions 2 NPCs 3 New Creatures 2 New relics 1 Character generation system (Bonus Offer System) 29 illustrations 44 Pages

191094.name: Excavator Monthly (Issue 6)

rpgissuearticle.170437: Article: Scavengers and Excavators… what’s the difference?

191094.description:
From the publisher's website:

Ever want to play a post-apocalyptic ninja, cowboy, marine, super model or hulking mutant freak? Now you can! Issue 6 covers 20 stereotypes available as player characters.

Another special feature in this issue is Tiny Terrors; 12 nasty critters to keep your players on their toes including mutant black widow spiders, jumping wood ticks, saw jawed newts and grass leeches to name a few. We also cover how to assign NPCs for your players to control complete with a randomized selection, articles on the difference between scavengers and excavators, outrunning your comrades, two new NPCs: Graydon the Mad and Zako the Dealer, along with the survival Pistol and Over-Armor-Tac-Harness for new relics.

Excavator Monthly is the official magazine for The Mutant Epoch milieu, covering the TME RPG, fiction, art and more. Not using the Outland System? No worries, there is a ton here that any post apocalyptic GM can utilize

This issue includes:
• Special Critter Issue: Tiny Terrors:: 12 nasty little beasts
• 2 NPCs
• 2 New relics
• 20 Player Character Stereotypes types
• Player Controlled NPCs
• Outrun Your Comrades
• Scavengers and Excavators
• 32 illustration
• 44 pages

191095.name: Scoundrel
191095.description:
Scoundrel is a single player rogue-like card game for use with a standard deck of playing cards. It was developed by Zack Gage and Kurt Bieg for Train Jam 2011.

All Jokers, red face cards, and red aces are removed from the deck. The remaining cards serve as monsters (spades and clubs), weapons (diamonds), and health potions (hearts) valued from 2-14 (Two through Ace). The rooms of the dungeon are created by laying out cards in groups of four. Progress is made through the dungeon by playing three of the four dungeon cards. The fourth card serves as the foundation for a new room. Rooms can be reset in their entirety as many times as needed but never twice in a row.

Weapons may be equipped to attack multiple monsters in descending order of their value with damage being dealt to the player for monster values in excess of the equipped weapon. The weapon breaks if it is used to attack a monster of equal or greater value than the previous monster. Attacking a monster without an equipped weapon depletes the players health for the full attack value of the monster. Health potions may be used to increase life points up to the maximum starting value of 20. Playing a second potion in succession nullifies the effect of the second potion.

The game ends when life points reach zero or the player has progressed through the entire dungeon.

191096.name: The Curse of the Kingspire

rpg.10737: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

191096.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Level 2 Adventure

Strange mists and weird lights glimmer and seethe along the banks of the Drachenvold Swamp. The folk of Kingshire have vanished like ghosts into the swamp, leaving only strange idols in their wake. At the heart of the fetid marsh, ruins of an ancient keep are all that remain of a once mighty band of rebel elder kith lords. But the ruined keep is home to a hungry curse capable of drawing the heroes back through time and space. Cast into a foreign realm of endless horror and bloodshed, it will take all your courage and cunning to end...the Curse of the Kingspire.

191098.name: Dark Ring: Hong Kong
191098.description:
Dark Ring is a card game designed for 4-8 people. Simple to learn, highly strategic, little luck involved.

Players act as Dark Ringers and needs to do their best to collect Energy Orbs each round. Each player would be assigned a secret role at the beginning of the game (either Innovator, Protector or Hunter). There are a total of 120 Play cards in this game. Each Play card would have 2 functions. The first is to use it as an action, and the second is to use it for scoring. Players need to choose a player to be the first Host. Every player needs to give one card faced down to the Host. The Host player would then decide which cards to give back to each player, faced down again. These cards would then become Trace cards to be used for scoring. In a clockwise order, starting from the Host player, everyone would have 2 chances to perform different actions by using Play cards from their hand. Play cards can either investigate or alter the Trace cards on the field. After 2 Action rounds, players need to decide to either take or give up their Trace card. Since there are positive and negative Scores, players should make their decisions wisely. The next player would then become the new Host and starts a new round. The game ends when any player collects 10 or more Orbs. Everyone then needs to reveal their Role and determine which team is the winner.

191099.name: Dungeon Master's Screen: Rage of Demons
191099.description:
Publisher blurb:

This screen is the perfect companion for those Dungeon Masters running the Out of the Abyss adventure, or any trek into the Underdark. The front includes ominous images of several demon lords while the back provides quick reference to maps, random encounter tables, and everything you need for an extended stay in the Underdark.

191100.name: Wickie: Wind in de zeilen
191100.description:
Based on the Cartoon character Wickie the viking

Wickie and the Vikings are on their way home on their drakar with a valuable treasure, when suddenly, Terrible Sven starts chasing them. The boat from Halvar and Wickie is much slower, so they have to hide in the fjords, a dangerous mission, but luckily Wickie has some maps from the fjords. Aid Wickie and his crew to find his way through the fjords back home.

In this two-player dexterity game, one player is Wickie who gives instructions, the other one is the boatsman who blows the ship over the waves through the fjords.
The carton box has a plastic inlay which has to be filled with water and has a little boats and dangerous riffs.

If you succeed to cooperate and get your ship into the safe harbour, you gain distance on terrible Sven, otherwise he comes closer

191101.name: Spellbook Cards: Arcane Archetypes
191101.description:
From the front cover:

This additional arcane spellbook contains all of the patron, origin, and tradition spells that warlocks, sorcerers, and wizards might discover.


From the back cover:

Contains 18 durable, laminated cards including: 16 for Warlocks, 1 for Sorcerers and 1 for Wizards. The perfect supplement to complete any arcane spellcaster's collection of spells.

191102.name: Spellbook Cards: Cleric Domains
191102.description:
From the front cover:

This additional cleric spellbook contains all of the domain spells a cleric is granted by thier chosen deity.


From the back cover:

Contains 43 durable, laminated cards for Clerics of any calling The perfect supplement to complete any Cleric's collection of spells.

191103.name: Ira dei Giusti: Saga Completa
191103.description:
From the back of the book:

La Piaga del Mondo ridusse in pezzi la realtà mortale all’alba dell’Era dei Presagi Perduti, annientando la nazione del Sarkoris e scatenando una bellicosa e famelica orda demoniaca sul mondo. Solo il repentino intervento di alcune nazioni di cavalieri, barbari ed eroi riuscì a bloccare l'armata dei demoni contenendola negli aspri territori del perduto Sarkoris e, nel corso del secolo successivo, crociata dopo crociata ha cercato di sconfiggere e cacciare definitivamente quelle malevole creature, senza però mai riuscirci. La linea di artefatti magici conosciuti come pietre di guardia, che si erge a protezione lungo i confini della Piaga del Mondo, è quanto di più vicino ad una vittoria le crociate siano riuscite a raggiungere. Ma queste pietre riescono a malapena a contenere i demoni e a offrire una qualche protezione, e così quando una di essa viene sabotata, i demoni all'interno della Piaga sciamano in un massiccio attacco senza precedenti contro Kenabres. La città cade e alcuni dei più grandi difensori ed eroi dei crociati vengono uccisi, prima ancora che la Quinta Crociata abbia potuto avere inizio. C'è qualche prode che vorrà o potrà ergersi a baluardo contro l’orda terrificante dei demoni per evitare che le armate di Deskari, il Signore dei Demoni della Schiera delle Locuste, inghiottano il mondo?
Il Manuale della Saga Ira dei Giusti contiene:

Tutti i sei capitoli della saga originale.
PNG completi di background e tesori specifici per la campagna.
Articoli sui principali luoghi di Ira dei Giusti: Kenabres, Alushinyrra e le Terre dell'Abisso.
Rivelazioni su Baphomet e Deskari e sulle reliquie perdute delle Crociate.
Un bestiario ricco di nuovi demoni e creature che abitano gli abissi oltre la Piaga del Mondo.





Translation courtesy of Google:

The Plague of the world reduced to pieces the deadly realities dawn of the Age of Lost Omens, destroying the nation of Sarkoris and unleashing a warlike and hungry horde on the demonic world. Only the sudden intervention of some nations of knights, barbarians and heroes managed to block the army of demons containing it in the harsh lands of the lost Sarkoris and, during the following century, the crusade after crusade tried to defeat and finally drive them malevolent creatures, without ever succeeding. The line of magical artifacts known as guard stones, which rises to protection along the borders of the Plague the World, is about as close to a victory the Crusades have been able to achieve. But these stones can barely contain the demons and to offer some protection, and so when it is sabotaged, the demons inside the Plague shaman in a massive unprecedented attack Kenabres. The city falls and some of the greatest defenders and heroes of the Crusaders are killed, even before the Fifth Crusade was able to begin. There is some strong man to take or can stand as a bulwark against the horde of terrifying demons to prevent the armies of Deskari, the Demon Lord of the Host Locust, swallow the world?
 
The Saga Wrath of the Righteous Manual contains:

All six chapters of the original saga.
PNG complete background and specific treasure for the campaign.
Articles on the main places of Wrath of the Righteous: Kenabres, Alushinyrra and Terre Abyss.
Revelations of Baphomet and Deskari and the lost relics of the Crusades.
A bestiary full of new demons and creatures that inhabit the depths beyond the Plague of the world.

191104.name: Spellbook Cards: Druid Circles
191104.description:
From the front cover:

This additional druid spellbook contains all of the circle spells a druid might gain from the lands they call home.


From the back cover:

Contains 21 durable, laminated cards for Druids from any Circle of the land. The perfect supplement to complete any Druid's collection of spells.

191105.name: Spellbook Cards: Martial Powers & Races
191105.description:
From the front cover:

This spellbook contains all of the maneuvers available to the strategic fighter as well as innate spells for the various races of the realms.


From the back cover:

Contains 61 durable, laminated cards including: 16 Battlemaster maneuvers, 3 totem Barbarian abilities, 19 Monk techniques, all the spell-like racial abilities for the Aasimar, Drow, Firbolg, Forest Gnome, Genasi, High Elf, Tiefling, and Triton subraces.

191106.name: Spellbook Cards: Monk Traditions
191106.description:
From the front cover:

This monk spellbook contains all of the spell-like abilities a monk might learn during their training.


From the back cover:

Contains 19 durable, laminated cards for Monks of any tradition. The perfect supplement to accompany any Monk's collection of abilities.

191107.name: Spellbook Cards: Paladin Oaths
191107.description:
From the front cover:

This additional paladin spellbook contains all of the oath spells a paladin needs to follow his chosen path.


From the back cover:

Contains 24 durable, laminated cards for Paladins who have taken their Oath. The perfect supplement to complete any Paladin's collection of spells.

191110.description:
Delve into the enchanted woods of Sugi, meet the spirits dwelling there, and guide your predilect descendants so that they are the first to make it to the Temple.

In Sugi, players represent the spirit ancestors trying to guide their descendants through the forest so they find the Temple. Each player has a family tree indicating which are their favorite descendants and win points if they arrive in the right order. In turn order, players must play one of their cards in hand in one of these two ways:


Adding the card to the movement line face down. When there are five movement cards, they are revealed and the movements resolve.
Discarding the card to use its special ability. (Rotate a card or tile, draw cards, discard from the movement line...)


The author, Víctor Samitier (aka Kiru) is a member of the Spanish association of board game designers Ludo, coming from an artistic background in the fields of music and cinema. In 2015 he won the express board game design contest "crearxcrearxcrear" in the Granollers fair “JugarxJugar”.
191110.name: Sugi

191111.description:
NASCARD Racing Simulator is a motorsport racing card game for 1-9 players.

The game is intented to be played with 1/64 diecast cars but you can play with the cards only.

The game system is simple but sophisticated, cars follow each other in line (1 car by space, on 1 to 3 lines dependings race and tracks),
simultaneously all the players reveal 1 Speed card, and Action cards.
