In the area known as The Spine of the Dragon, the ancient temple to the air aspect of the Great Mother still stands, shrouded in mystery and superstition. A mission to reclaim the site shortly after the end of the Hoyrall Wars was aborted prematurely without discovering the fate of the priests once serving the goddess at this mystical site. The madness of the past seeks to trap the heroes as they venture forth to uncover the mysteries therein, and the madness of the present seeks to hide the truths lurking under the breath of the goddess.

Also included in this adventure:

Engineering puzzles and challenges to test the monument building skills of your players.
A new monster, the Drakhalfryda: a terrible byproduct of the Dracoprime’s plummet into southern Aventyr.
Five new magic items and two magical boons (for those willing to pay the price).
A method to track the PCs’ influence on the future

191222.name: Spontaneous Subterranean Spore Groves
191222.description:
From publisher blurb:

EAT or BE EATEN… in the DARK DEPTHS OF THE WORLD!

Shriekers, yellow mold, violet fungi…

Did you ever wonder how such teeming hordes survive in the dark tunnels of the underworld, in the caverns and caves that honeycomb the world? Magic, surface raids and consuming other races help a lot, but even the subterranean depths has an ecosystem. Wafting through the depths of tunnels and chasms are spores of fungal growths called “subterranean spore groves” where there is dampness, carrion, or radiation from ores in the ground. They can sprout up overnight, for such groves are essential to underground survival, and adventuring parties have been saved by harvesting the edible masses in these subterranean oases of life… Or they have perished from the often lethal components of such a colony, and the beings that are attracted by them…

Subterranean Spore Groves is the latest entry from the Purple Duck Storeroom, including several useful tables for generating these eerie oases of crepuscular life in the dark depths of caves, caverns, and dark places adventuring parties love to travel. Remember the old D1 Descent into the Depths? You can quickly build a spore grove with this entry, which also includes a new fungal hazard, cyan fungus! Get Purple Duck Storeroom: Subterranean Spore Groves today, from Purple Duck Games- where our games are what you want!

191223.name: Wizard's Tower
191223.description:
From the Introduction:

This five-encounter adventure takes the heroes from Rivenshore to the wizard's tower on the eastern peninsula that encloses Brecken Bay. The wizard, Mortain, has gotten himself into strife and needs the kids' help!


Encounters: Five
Difficulty: Normal
Duration: 45-60 minutes

191224.name: Simon's Dinner Theatre (Pathfinder Edition)
191224.description:
From publisher blurb:

The fourth instalment in our Tangible Taverns line is Simon's Dinner Theatre, which details a delightful dinner theatre with fantastic food. As always, we have included rumour and event tables, a tavern map, and descriptions of frequent faces about the establishment (which include names, physical features and personalities for the actors). We have also included a table with play titles and descriptions so you can let your players know what their characters are viewing. Instead of just deducting a few gold pieces and letting your PCs regain some spells, give them a chance to explore and interact with the city around them at Simon’s Dinner Theatre.

191225.name: 100 Oddities for a Wizard's Tower
191225.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to 100 Oddities for a Wizard's Tower, the fifth entry in the “Oddities” series of sourcebooks, each of which brings you 100 imaginative elements, curios, and details to add to your games, in whatever way you like.

Oddities are intended to aid GM creativity, turning possibly bland areas or gaming episodes into something more, and the goal of this publication is to make things more fun and to take your imagination in directions it might not otherwise have gone. They fill in the corners of a bookshelf, a room, a level, a scenario, with all the sorts of things that add interest but take loads of time to come up with. A good oddity awakens curiosity and creativity, in player and GM alike, adding interest to an encounter, or even making one out of nothing.

191226.name: Deck of Heroes
191226.description:
Welcome traveller, to our tavern "The Laughing Elf"! Sit back and relax with this popular strategic card game. Play as either Human, Undead, Elf or Orc. Build a deck from 108 unique cards. Compete with friends and foes alike, in both local and online matches, or practice your skills against the Ai.
As you probably have noticed, the game draws a lot of inspiration from Hearthstone.

Source: The Game Website.

191227.name: Lootfest
191227.description:
This is a simple but fun game. Kill monsters, loot them for gold, buy bigger weapons. Enjoy a top view adventure game with classic controls, where your goal is to find and destroy the three evil bosses that are terrorizing your country.

Source: The Game Website.

191228.name: Lootfest II
191228.description:
Lootfest is back for everyone who loves classic adventure games. With more monsters, weapons, missions and of course - more loot!
Explore a large world with your friends, using an easy drop-in multiplayer. Any combination of split screen and online gameplay is supported.

Source: The Game Website.

191229.name: Lootfest 360
191229.description:
Party-style adventure game, set in a fantasy voxel world. It is the third adventure in the Lootfest series.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgamehonor.40503: 2016 Golden Geek Best Family Board Game Nominee

191231.description:
Crafters, builders and carriers — your help is needed to dispel the mists of Nebula! The people of the valley will reward you handsomely if you harvest and exploit our many resources, open paths through the mists, and help our settlers build new structures. Cooperate temporarily with other builders in order to create paths and share goods, but do not forget your own objectives. Will you have a statue erected in your honor on the Nebula City plaza?

A game of Via Nebula starts with a board showing a hexagonal grid, some production sites with a few available resources on them (wood, stone, wheat, and pigs), building sites in various areas scattered over the whole board, and a lot of mist.

Turn after turn, players have two actions at their disposal from these options: They may clear the mist of a hex to create new paths of transportation, open new production sites, open a building site in a city, carry resources from any production site to their own building sites, and, of course, achieve a construction. Resources and paths through the mist may be used by all the players. This initially induces a kind of cooperation, but eventually other players will take advantage of your actions!

To achieve a construction, you fulfill a contract on one of your cards. You start the game with two contracts, and four more contracts are available for all players to see and use on a first come, first served basis — and that's where the cooperation abruptly stops. Additionally, most contracts have special powers that are triggered on completion.

The game ends when a player finishes a fifth building. Opponents each take two final actions, then players score based on the number of cleared hexes and opened production sites and the point value of their contracts, with a bonus for the player who ended the game.
191231.name: Via Nebula

191232.name: Rope
191232.description:
From publisher blurb:

Call to Arms is a book line for players and gamemasters alike. Each book focuses on a different type of item, expanding rules for those items and adding everything from new mundane and magical examples of the item to new character options related to the item. Call to Arms: Rope focuses on one of the most versatile tools available to any adventurer to make rope not only essential but dynamic in play. Exciting new uses of rope are presented and old uses are expanded on and clarified. New traits, feats, and items will allow players to dance like a circus acrobat, build like a rigger, belay like a mountain climber, and even bind the gods themselves.

Items covered in Call to Arms: Rope include...

A Brief History of Rope
Rules and Rope
Breaking Rope and Masterwork Rope
Improvised Rope Tricks
Character Options including Traits, Feats, Class Options and Archetypes!
Knots
Using Rope to communicate
and much, much more!

191233.name: The Hussar
191233.description:
From publisher blurb:

While the cavalier or paladin tends to ride their opponents down with the force of their weight and their mount, the hussar rides a lighter beast and relies on speed and agility. She relies on her skill as a rider and trusts in her mount rather than heavy armor to stay safe and makes quick, darting hit and run attacks with a sword, polearm, or even ranged weapons.

The Hussar's role is to harry at the edge of battle, picking off those who stray too far from line or formation. They fight in an active style somewhat similar to the rogue, but may also be sought out for their skills as riders and sometimes even as trainers.

191234.name: INK
191234.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Grand Stair stretches behind the scenes of the multiverse,
The Doors upon its unfathomably vast span leading the way to gossamer worlds of limitless variety and infinite possibility. In some worlds, two dimensions are more than enough in which to live.

INK is a vast and sprawling two-dimensional gossamer world populated with illustrated life – an entire reality filled with sentient scribbles, conscious cartoons, and proud portrait civilizations, all imported from across the multiverse by the mysterious Annunaki, like some sort of omni-galactic zoo for drawings. It is a place where you can stroll the pages of a comic book, sail the sepia-tone sea of an ancient map, and go on walkabout in a great white outback filled with stick figure hunters and predatory erasers. Forget everything you think you know about space, life, and existence... because some of reality just isn't drawn for you.

191236.description:
Description from the publisher:

"The Great Shepherd sent me to earth to heal his lambs, wherever I might find them." – George R.R. Martin, A Game of Thrones

Westeros lies under a deceptive calm. In King’s Landing, Eddard Stark pulls another layer away from the lies surrounding Robert Baratheon’s children. The Eyrie is shaken by the arrival of Tyrion Lannister and his desperate gambit to win his freedom. Across the Narrow Sea, a maegi plots her vengeance against Khal Drogo for the destruction of her peaceful village. Everywhere, events are set in motion that will bear terrible consequences.

In the Calm over Westeros Chapter Pack, the first cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game approaches the end of the first book in A Song of Ice and Fire. Like the other Chapter Packs of the Westeros cycle, this expansion offers new cards and plots to increase your deckbuilding options. You’ll also find instantly recognizable characters and locations entering the game for the first time, including Bronn, Mirri Maz Duur, and The Eyrie. With the further addition of two new plots — one loyal to House Tyrell and one neutral — this Chapter Pack will fuel your future decks and strategies.
191236.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game (Second Edition) – Calm over Westeros

169255.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game (Second Edition)

191237.name: The Competitive Quest (Vol 1 No 1 - Nov 1975)
191237.description:
The Competitive Quest
Volume 1, Number 1
November 1975

Published as PDF in 2015.

191238.name: Punto 180
191238.description:
It's year 1978 and in Italy on promulgate the law 180, which ratify the closing down of all psychiatric hospitals.
The idea of the game is to remember and relive the atmosphere of this important period...
Players identify themselves in a doctor releasing patients from their jails or in the severe guardians trying to repress this situation, moving the pieces on 8 different boards.
There's just one doctor to free all the patients, but the guardians can use their superior number to overwhelm him, so move carefully and try to reach the exit with planning and strategy.
Each board, representing original layout of real mental hospitals and asylums, is enriched by pictures of the author's photography-project "Persistenze".
Punto 180 is not just a game: it's a unique crossover and a way to let everybody know about a so important law, that had a worldwide impact and changed the life of many people.

Each turn players must move every active piece.
The doctor move his white piece first, horizontally or vertically how many spaces as he likes. The patients (yellow pieces) start the game in their jails and the doctor must stop in an adjacent space to free them; once free, a patient moves the same way of the doctor and must exit the board reaching the yellow arrows. Every patient get out this way scores 1 point for the doctor's player.
The guardians (black pieces) move again like the doctor, but can take the yellow pieces (the patients) moving on them.
Each yellow pieces taken this way is removed from the board and scores 1 point for the guardians player.
Important: a guardian can move on a patient only if black pieces has numerical superiority or tie on that line of the grid! Moreover, they can not overstep or jump the doctor white piece.
The player with more points at the end of the game is the winner.

191239.name: GardenMind

videogamehonor.33089: 2011 CVA Best Social/Casual Game of the Year Nominee

191239.description:
A series of fun and challenging brain games. Get high scores to unlock higher difficulties and a bonus game.

Source: The Game Website.

191240.name: The Worlds of TANSTAAFL (Vol 2 No 1 - Jan 1983)
191240.description:
The Worlds of TANSTAAFL
Volume 2 Number 1
January 1983

Published as PDF in 2015

191241.name: The Worlds of TANSTAAFL (Vol 2 No 2 - Feb 1983)
191241.description:

February 1983

Published as PDF in 2015

191242.name: Ashton and the Augments
191242.description:
From publisher blurb:

The death of a scientist friend and a mad chase through the sewers uncovers a twisted plot, a maddening secret society, a femme fatale and mutant monsters. Nobody ever said the life of a gumshoe in the city was going to be easy. But will a conversation with one of the city's most wealthy humanitarians and industrialists lead to a valuable contact, or deeper into the pit of corruption and conspiracy?

Welcome to Ashton and the Augments, the latest adventure module for the Amazing Adventures role playing game. Along with the Amazing Adventures core rulebook, This ready-to-play adventure includes everything you need to run an exciting adventure for 3rd to 6th-level characters.

191249.description:
Game objective: Make your way through the board encountering terrifying Spooks along your Journey to defeat toughest of Spooks; the Dragon King!
Plot: You have begun a journey full of Spooks. There are seven Spooks waiting to Spook YOU! Can you make it out alive? You are about to embark on the most terrifying Spook Journey ever.
There are various spaces on the board that you'll encounter. Tombstone Spaces, Pit Space, Vine Spaces and Item Spaces. Players may share spaces only on Exit Spaces or Battle Spaces. If you land on another player’s pawn at the end of your turn, the player occupying the space moves back to the next available space on the board.
191249.name: The Spooks Journey Game

191250.name: Greebles: Mashup Monster Combat
191250.description:
Dueling tile game that's a cross between dominoes, consequences and certain pocket monster type franchises.

Build monsters from your hand of tiles and send them to destroy your opponent, crushing anything that is in the way. The first set contains three decks - bugs, bots and beasts that can normally only combine with themselves unless a "combine" card is used to cross the gene pools. Original Artwork from Tang Mu though templates are provided to go make your own sets and fight! Files are available for Print 'n' Play or laser cutting your own set.

With a starting hand of 7 tiles, players have 3 actions per turn, picking up, playing or attacking (can repeat the same action more than once to get to three) A monster can only be started with a head section and can only attack when it is completed with a tail. As many body tiles can be played in between these two providing that the symbols on the sides match (combine tiles come into play here). Each tile adds different features to the monster - a red dot/explosion means another d6 is added to the attack pool and a shield with a number in it is a hit point that can only be destroyed by an attack die with a number equal or higher than it. If all the hit points on a tile are destroyed then that tile is taken off the monster and put back into the bag. Players also have three hit points of their own health and are removed from the game when they are destroyed (they can choose which monster defends the attack or can take the damage themselves to keep their precious creations safe)

For extra silliness, when attacking the player has to shout the entire name of their monster (each tile has a portion on the side of it) leading to absurd and often hilarious monsters weighing into battle.

Greebles is published with a Creative Commons Attribution Non-commercial share alike licence as the creator is a great fan of collaboration. It was partly inspired by the drawing game consequences (or exquisite corpses if you went to art school :p) where a piece of paper is folded multiple times with a segment on a body drawn on each and then folded before passing to the next person so the final monster is only revealed when the paper is unfurled. There are blank templates available for the creation of your own sets and the author is planning on releasing official expansion packs as a way of showcasing other illustrators and ideas. A card game variant is also in the works.

191251.name: Misfits in Action (Issue 3.01 - Jan 2016)

rpgissuearticle.180773: Misfit Studios' New Releases - Game Products

191251.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Misfit Studios January 2016 Newsletter Contains Release Details on:

W Fraser Sandercombe Presents: Toystore
Crawthorne's Catalog of Creatures: Infected Zombie
Jason Moser Presents: The Beast
Scott Harshbarger Presents: Dog Walking
Brett Neufeld Presents: Angelic Goddess
Brett Neufeld Presents: Filler Art
Earl Geier Presents: Krampus

191252.name: The Burning Wheel Codex
191252.description:
From the back cover:

The Burning Wheel Codex stands as the companion volume to the award-winning Burning Wheel Fantasy Roleplaying System. Beginners and veterans alike will see the game in a new light and find their campaigns enhanced by this fantastic new material.

The tome offers insight into building settings and adventures for you Burning Wheel campaigns, helpful commentary on writing Beliefs and Instincts, a trove of magical artifacts, 12 new magical arts and five new sets of lifepaths: the Wizard Burner, Dark Elves, Roden, Trolls and Great Wolves. Truly a grimoire worthy of wizards and warriors everywhere.

Presented in the same easy-to-read style as the Burning Wheel core rules, the Codex condenses, distills and refines the experience of ten years playing one of the greatest fantasy roleplaying games ever published.

191253.name: Shallows: A Whailz Battle Game
191253.description:
Shallows is a 2-6 player card battle game using 42 custom Whailz with unique abilities in a free for all competitive fray that can be played again and again.

Shallows uses a unique 6 suite Attack/defense system that is very easy to learn but allows each player to be unique in both his strategy and combat style. Players can opt for a fully aggressive tactic or even defensive approach.

The game mechanics is a combination of War and Mag Blast, but with the decision making on the player's side, not the cards.

On top of that, this game is packed with parodies. From SNES games to 90's cartoons, animes to internet jokes.

191254.name: Newer Super Mario Bros. Wii
191254.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of New Super Mario Bros. Wii.




Newer Super Mario Bros. Wii is a full unofficial sequel to New Super Mario Bros. Wii, crafted over the span of 3 years by a team of devoted Nintendo fans. Playable legally on any homebrew-enabled Wii; no piracy or hardware mods needed.

In Newer, you'll find...

128 all-new levels on a gigantic world map
Remixed and original graphics, themes and music
The return of a classic Power-Up
New and old bosses and enemies
Fun with 1 to 4 players, just like the original game




Source: The Game Website.

191255.name: Newer Super Mario Bros. Wii: Summer Sun
191255.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of New Super Mario Bros. Wii.




Newer is a full unofficial sequel to New Super Mario Bros. Wii, crafted over the span of 3 years by a team of devoted Nintendo fans. Playable legally on any homebrew-enabled Wii; no piracy or hardware mods needed.

Newer: Summer Sun is a short game with a hot theme, originally released in Summer 2012. It features 23 new levels and some fresh music!

Source: The Game Website.

191256.name: Newer Super Mario Bros. Wii: Holiday Special
191256.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of New Super Mario Bros. Wii.




Newer is a full unofficial sequel to New Super Mario Bros. Wii, crafted over the span of 3 years by a team of devoted Nintendo fans. Playable legally on any homebrew-enabled Wii; no piracy or hardware mods needed.

Newer: Holiday Special is a frosty adventure created to celebrate Christmas 2011. Explore 8 of the coldest levels you'll ever see, set to chilly music and new, icy textures!

Source: The Game Website.

191257.name: Another Super Mario Bros. Wii
191257.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of New Super Mario Bros. Wii.




Another Super Mario Bros. Wii is a simple mod created by Skawo and released in December 2010 which includes a full set of new levels with the same themes as the original game. This release precedes the development of Newer Super Mario Bros Wii.

Source: The Game Website.

191258.name: Stray Souls: Dollhouse Story
191258.description:
Welcome to a town where something that should not exist runs free; where a desperate wife will risk her beating heart to find her husband; and where a terrible secret lies buried behind an orphanage. Search for clues, solve puzzles, and unlock new areas as you visit spine-chilling locations, play stimulating mini-games and locate hidden objects.

Source: The Publisher Website.

191259.name: Front Page Splash
191259.description: To create a news story by drawing random words and fitting them together to make sense until the block is filled up, then a headline is chosen. The winner is the one who has added the most words.

videogamehonor.42680: 2017 Game Critics Best Strategy Game of the Year Nominee

191273.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




BattleTech is a turn-based, tactical 'Mech strategy game being developed by Harebrained Schemes, set to be released early 2017 for Windows, Mac, and Linux. With the financial support of a successful Kickstarter campaign, the game will feature an expanded single player story campaign and a PVP multiplayer mode.

From the Wikipedia entry, "In the game, the player assumes the role of a mercenary commander leading a team of powerful combat vehicles called mechs. The player is responsible for selecting each mech's model, armaments, and skills, and controls a team of four mechs in combat. The world of BattleTech is dominated by powerful noble houses locked in a devastating war, and the player selects one or more houses to serve."

More information can be found through the official game site: battletechgame.com

Source: Wikipedia, "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BattleTech_%28video_game%29&qu...;, available under the CC-BY-SA License.

videogamehonor.38786: 2016 Golden Joystick Best Indie Game of the Year Nominee

Pony Island is a suspense puzzle game in disguise. You are in limbo, trapped in a malevolent and malfunctioning arcade machine devised by the devil himself.
The devil detests having his puzzles solved and poor programming exposed; you will need to think outside the box to proceed and you will be insulted when you do.
In Pony Island you will...
Peer behind the rotting curtain of "Pony Island" to repair its broken code
Be forced to play along with The Devil's demented game of ponies
Explore the depths of the cryptic software system that runs His game

Source: The Developer Website.

191284.name: Goblin Defenders:  Steel 'n'  Wood
191284.description:
User Summary

A typical tower defence game in which different monsters take a path to your base. You can defence with archers, bombs, freezing, poison, and whirling blades.

191285.name: Less: Like Chess but Less!
191285.description:
Less is a simple strategy board game for two or four players. It's a simple game which can be set up in seconds and the rules can be learned in less than a minute. Just take the nine board pieces, place the game pieces and you’re ready to go! The goal is to move your four pieces to the opponents starting corner before he moves them to yours.

The board is set up randomly at the beginning of every game and there are over 100,000 combinations to try out. Less can also quickly be expanded into a four-player game by adding another set of tiles to the deck. This way you have to work together with your partner to bring both of your pieces to the other side before the other pair of players does the same.

boardgamecompilation.195338: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Complete Hero Variant Collection

191286.description:
This promotional card from the Villains of the Multiverse pre-order event. The Scholar, John Rhodes, has seen too much in his studies.

HP: 31
Innate Power: Channel. The Scholar deals himself and 1 target X Infernal Damage, where X = the number of cards you've discarded since the end of your last turn plus 1.
191286.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Scholar of the Infinite Promo Card

boardgamecompilation.195338: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Complete Hero Variant Collection

191287.description:
A promo character card that offers new options for The Shattered Timelines' Chrono-Ranger.

HP: 29

Innate Power: True Purpose. Select a non-Hero Target. Until the start of your next turn, all Bounty cards also affect that target and are not destroyed when a target leaves play.
191287.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Chrono-Ranger: The Best of Times Promo Card

191288.name: Brain Freeze
191288.description:
Brain Freeze is a cool new kids strategy game of secret sweet treats that helps develop important mental skills through exciting back-and-forth game play! In Brain Freeze, two players or teams race to correctly guess the secret sweet treat that the other player or team has chosen. The kid-friendly symbols include Ice Cream Sandwich, Milkshake, Ice Cream Cone, Popsicle, and Snow Cone. Using only strategic thinking, deduction, memory and logic, players make guesses, record answers, and eliminate variables until they feel they can correctly guess the opponent's secret sweet treat. Guess right and Win, but guess wrong and...you got a Brain Freeze!

Brain Freeze is based on the award-winning gameplay of the Telepathy board game (Parent's Choice Foundation Recommended Seal and National Parenting Center Seal of Approval). Brain Freeze is an ideal game to introduce strategy, logic and deduction to younger kids in a fun manner they'll enjoy, making the process of learning important skills they'll benefit from in school and life a blast! And with a minimal amount of pieces required, Brain Freeze is fast to set-up, easy to learn, and always provides a fun mental challenge for hours and hours of play that never gets old.

boardgamecompilation.195338: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Complete Hero Variant Collection

191289.description:
A promo card released in conjunction with pre-ordering Villains of the Multiverse.

HP: 27

Innate Power: Desperate Prey. Select (Crocodile Icon), (Gazelle Icon), or (Rhinoceros Icon). Until the end of your next turn, you may activate that icon's effects. Either draw a card or play a card.
191289.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: The Hunted Naturalist Promo Card

boardgamecompilation.195338: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Complete Hero Variant Collection

191290.description:
A set of alternate characters released as a pre-order promotion for Villains of the Multiverse.

Dr. Medico
Innate Power: Regeneration. Each of the Sentinels regain 1 HP. You may draw a card.

Mainstay
Innate Power: Haymaker. Mainstay deals 1 target 2 Melee Damage. The next damage dealt to that target is irreducible.

The Idealist
Innate Power: T.K. Thump. The Idealist deals 1 target 1 Psychic Damage. Reduce damage dealt by a target dealt damage this way by 1 until the start of your next turn.

Writhe
Innate Power: Shroud. The next time a non-hero target is destroyed, you may move it to the bottom of its deck instead of the trash
191290.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: The Adamant Sentinels Promo Pack

191291.name: RiddleCraft
191291.description:
On an archaeological expedition, you discover the ancient tome of riddles that you had long been searching for—sadly, its pages are torn to shreds beyond hope of reassembly. Your hopes dashed, you decide to raise your spirits by using the fragments of riddles that remain to hold a contest of wits and riddle-making with your friends at the local tavern…

As players lay down cards, a single riddle slowly gets more and more complicated. You must decide whether to add more to the riddle or to challenge someone to answer it.
You can choose some of the riddle’s clues, but don’t get caught without an answer!

191292.name: Mafia the Party Game
191292.description:
The Mafia have infiltrated your town! You must find them and lynch them. Each day you, the civilians, will hold a town hall meeting to vote for a suspected Mafia to lynch. Get it right and you might survive. Get it wrong, and you're in danger because every night the Mafia secretly meet and choose a civilian to kill...

Mafia the Party Game has multiple unique roles that you won't find anywhere else. Each set comes with a Mafia logo pouch, Instruction booklet, 4 Mafia cards, 1 Detective, 1 Doctor, 16 Civilians (8 female, 8 male), 1 Godfather, 1 Barman, 2 Rival Mafia, 1 Cupid, 1 Lawyer, 1 Vigilante, 1 Undercover Cop, 1 Magician, 1 Serial Killer, 1 Postman, 1 Moderator, 1 Grandma with a Gun, and 1 Miller.

191293.name: Sanctuary's Edge
191293.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sanctuary's Edge is a futuristic sci-fi roleplaying game that tells the story of humanity’s struggle for survival on a harsh and unforgiving world set in an unknown future, on the face of a world that has forgotten the touch of civilisation.

Players can step into the shoes of one of the many individuals that try to make their way on Sanctuary. The intrepid explorer, coin-counting mercenary, visionary pioneer, meticulous researcher, fast-talking socialite, or the ingenious inventor – these are just some of the many characters players can stick into one adventure after another.

Character can pick from one or more or Sanctuary’s Edge five distinct fully-customisable 'Characters Professions': the hardy Soldier, the stealthy Outrider, the cunning Conman, the analytical Academic or the resourceful Techie.

Built on a proprietary BUILD system, combat is fast and fluid, making players capable of astounding, visceral feats all in the space of a few heartbeats, while still allowing for intricate social scenarios.

The world of Sanctuary is as diverse as it is dangerous. The mighty Five Factions that dominate the planet wage a savage not-so-cold war against one another.

Locked in a perpetual stalemate, their chess pieces are many. But for how long can the uneasy balance endure? They eye each other warily, sharpening claws and flexing muscles, waiting to pounce. Who will come out on top and emerge as victor?

Will it be the disciplined New Jherico, the enterprising Gauldenaand, the traditional Haven of Misu, the diplomatic United Awakened Territories or the divinely-mandated Immovable Empire?

What of the smaller piranhas in the pool that swim with the sharks – the myriad of profiteering corporations, strong-arm security armies, and technologically-adept combines? What niche will they carve out when the chips are down? Only time will tell.

Come join us on Sanctuary, and welcome to the Expanse.

191295.name: Somaliland 1940
191295.description:
Italy conquers British Somaliland

Somaliland ’40 simulates the Italian conquest of British Somaliland in August 1940. In this two player game, one player ontrols the Italian forces and the other the British forces.[...]
The map depicts the part of British Somaliland where the harshest combats took place. Each hex is about 10 km across (6.2 miles).
Each game turn represents two days. The ground unit counters principally represent battalions, armored companies and artillery batteries.

(source: rulebook)

191296.description:
RUMBLESLAM was designed to be a quick and fun game that you can play within an hour and has evolved into so much more. It is fast paced and all players are always active so no one gets bored waiting for their next go.

Battle one on one or team up with a friend to play against a pair of opponents. The more fighters in the ring the more action! Your team of wrestlers must try to eject the opponents team from the ring, something that gets much easier after a successful knockout!

RUMBLESLAM sees players tactically moving miniatures around a 1ft x 1ft board/ring, you'll have an array of choices at your disposal to help win the match, whether its performing dexterous wrestling moves, a punch to the face or even spending your action points to get the crowd fired up in your favour, giving your team that much needed boost to win the game.
Players will use dice rolls relevant to a stat on a wrestlers character profile card to try and knockout the opponents team, which will make ejecting them from the ring much easier.
191296.name: RUMBLESLAM

191297.name: Slab (Supers!)
191297.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bullies are all around us and come from all walks of life. It's tough enough to stand up to one when they are bigger and stronger, but what happens when they have super powers? Due to his abilities, Slab is a law enforecement nightmare. Do your heroes have what it takes to put him down?

191298.name: The Folio #05
191298.description:
From publisher blurb:

Time is running out for the members of the Ivory Scimitar as they strive against the Infernal Machine and Mithelvarn's Labyrinth. ROS5 Deep Dive into the Flooded Halls tests character's metal against an aquatic dungeon and is designed for characters levels 8-10. It is fully compatible with 1E & 5E rules systems.

191299.name: The Folio #06
191299.description:
From publisher blurb:

The final chapter in The Roslof Keep Campaign plays out as the Ivory Scimitar takes on the challenges of the 6th Level of Mitherlvarn's Labryinth. ROS6 Realms of Madness and Despari! tests character's metal against the final 4 'bosses' of the dungeon and is designed for characters levels 10-12. It is fully compatible with 1E & 5E rules systems.

boardgamehonor.40227: 2016 Golden Geek Best Card Game Nominee

191300.description:
Archaeology: The New Expedition is a reimplementation of the popular Archaeology: The Card Game (with several changes).

You are an archaeologist working the dig sites of the Egyptian desert. Search for the right pieces to complete torn parchments, broken pots, and other priceless artifacts. Explore an ancient pyramid in the hope of uncovering a huge stash of treasure! Trade shrewdly at the local marketplace to increase the value of your collection. Sell your treasures to the museum at just the right time for maximum profit.

But beware, the desert also has its dangers! A devastating sandstorm can throw your expedition into disarray, and cunning thieves lurk around the dig site ready to steal your prize discovery!

In Archaeology: The New Expedition, you want to find treasures and make the most money possible by selling them to the museum. Players start with four treasure cards in hand; one monument tile is chosen at random, then the chambers of the monument are loaded secretly with treasure cards.

On a turn, a player digs for treasure by drawing from the deck. If they find treasure, they don't show anyone and keep it; if they find a thief, they steal a card at random from an opponent; and if they find a sandstorm, all players lose half of their cards in hand to the marketplace, which starts the game with five face-up cards. (Each player has a tent that they can discard to avoid the effects of one sandstorm.) After digging, a player can:


Discard one or more maps to explore one chamber of the monument, looking at all the cards there and keeping some number of them.



Trade at the marketplace by laying down one or more treasure cards and picking up cards with equal or lesser trading value.



Sell to the museum by placing sets of treasure cards in front of them; in general, the more cards you have of a type, the more the set is worth.


Players can explore only once, but they can do the other actions repeatedly, and they can take these actions in any order. Once the deck is empty, players keep taking actions until they all pass in turn, after which they sell treasures to the museum. Whoever ends up with the most money wins!

According to the designer, Archaeology: The New Expedition differs from Archaeology: The Card Game through the inclusion of tent cards, the addition of new treasure types and additional cards to allow for five players, the adjustment of some treasure values, and the inclusion of six monuments instead of one to have more variety when exploring.
191300.name: Archaeology: The New Expedition

224831.name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Days Gone Bye Expansion

boardgameintegration.223864: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Prelude to Woodbury Solo Starter Set

191301.description:
The Walking Dead: All Out War is a tactical head-to-head game set in the walker-strewn Georgia countryside, a survival miniatures game from Mantic Games based on the characters from the pages of the bestselling The Walking Dead comic series. Your group will be pitted against other groups in a bitter fight for supplies, but the Walkers react to your every move. In this game, everyone and everything is trying to kill you.

In more detail, each player controls their own group of survivors made up of popular characters from The Walking Dead storyline, such as Rick, Shane, Michonne and many more. Each survivor is represented by a finely-detailed plastic miniature, which can be painted in your color scheme of choice. It comes with a character card highlighting their game stats and unique abilities, and it can be upgraded with a selection of weapon and equipment cards.

The game is set around Atlanta and the surrounding suburbs, and contains a gaming mat and a selection of barricades, abandoned cars and supplies to give it that authentic The Walking Dead atmosphere. Your survivors move across the board using the measuring stick included with the game, and you use the terrain to block Walker routes, sneak up on opposing survivors, or raid enemy camps for supplies.

During the game, you fight a bitter battle for resources against a rival group of survivors – but be careful not to make too much noise as you'll draw the attention of the Walkers, which are controlled by an AI system developed specifically for this game. They attack anyone who comes within reach — and because they are AI-controlled, you can play the game solo.

The base game includes rules for running simple campaigns and basic guidelines for designing your own characters.
191301.name: The Walking Dead: All Out War

191302.description:
The Arkadia tournament is now over, but the king's exiled evil brother Vadoor has caught the five adventurers and is sending them far away. To save the kingdom, our heroes must begin by fleeing a pirate ship. During their escape, they will find the legendary sunken city of Spectra, inhabited by a hitherto-unknown, ancient tribe of Loonies who appear to have come from another galaxy. Where will this new quest lead our adventurers?

In Loony Quest: The Lost City, the first expansion for Loony Quest, players discover five new worlds and strive to master the previously unseen challenges of this 32-level content pack! Travel through secret passages that let you reappear in another location on the level. A 3D-pyramid spaceship turns up the fun factor of the new levels and brings a new angle to the original Loony Quest game, boosting replayability.

New special stages and more bonus and penalty tokens add up to even more fun with the players around the table!
191302.name: Loony Quest: The Lost City

191303.name: Unnützes Quizzen: Tiere
191303.description:
Unnützes Quizzen: Tiere ("Unuseful Knowledge: Animals") is a German Trivia Game with obscure facts about animals.

From the Publisher (translated):
"Test your unuseful knowledge! Can fish die from sunburn? How many naps does a bunny have per day? And do herrings really communicate by farting? The big questions of the animal kingdom - in this quiz from the popular section of the NEON magazine, they will all be answered"

From the publisher (German):
Teste dein unnützes Wissen! Können Fische an Sonnenbrand sterben? Wie viele Nickerchen macht ein Kaninchen pro Tag? Und kommunizieren Heringe wirklich durch Furzen? Die großen Fragen der Tierwelt – in diesem Quiz zur beliebten Rubrik aus dem NEON-Magazin werden sie alle beantwortet! Für zu Hause, für unterwegs, für zwischendurch: 99 Quiz-Fragen zum Immerdabeihaben.

191304.name: GreenSpace

videogamehonor.33112: 2012 CVA Best Social/Casual Game of the Year Nominee

191304.description:
Players select pieces of trash for their GreenSpace Corps avatar to clear. Energy is required to clear trash off the planet. Players receive rewards for cleaning in the form of experience points and credits immediately after each piece of trash is cleaned.

Credits are used to build structures. Some structures can also produce credits, releasing the credits after an interval ranging from 15 minutes to one hour.

Source: Wikipedia, "GreenSpace", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

191305.name: Margaritaville Online

videogamehonor.33111: 2012 CVA Best Social/Casual Game of the Year Winner

191305.description:
User Summary

Margaritaville Online is a game where friends will be able to play minigames.

191307.name: UNO & Friends

videogamehonor.33131: 2013 CVA Best Social/Casual Game of the Year Winner

191307.description:
User Summary

A digital version of the physical boardgame.

191308.name: Go Nutz
191308.description:
Each player gets a squirrel and the objective is then to collect nuts in each of the five colors.

You move around the game board by dice rolls and collect nuts by landing on the squares with the colored nuts on them. When you roll your die you must move the entire roll unless you can reach a nut with less.

A fox is also in play and blocks the road he is on. The fox is moved freely on the board (not following paths) by a player when he rolls a one - though not to squares containing nuts or other players.

Player also start with 2 random pine-cone cards giving advantages that can be used during the players turn (jumping over the fox, exchanging a nut of one color for another and such). You can get more cards in 2 ways - either by landing on a pine-cone square or by landing on a square that contain another squirrel. When landing on such a square each of the 2 players have to roll a die and the one with the largest roll gets the pine-cone card.

191309.name: Possessão Arcana
191309.description:
Possessão Arcana ("Arcane Possession ") is a board game for 1 - 6 players, a Dungeon Crawler. And before you go defeat the enemies, you must first decide if you are prepared. A wide variety of demons invade the earth plane, from goblins to supreme lords of the underworld. It is up to you and your mates face these demons together and send back to hell.

But the Arcane Magic is wild and you can be corrupted. Be careful.

In Possessão Arcana, players will struggle with the demons, with magic, they need to find three magical artifacts, but it is not easy, the character has a Possession Arcana level, go to the maximum, the magician must fight with others, but if all artifacts are found, players will face Lord demon.

While exploring the city, a player rolls dice to calculate his attacks and defenses. He keeps check of his life, mana level and Posession Arcana. The demons are controlled by Artificial Intelligence through the Command and Aura cards.

191310.name: Star Wars: Star Destroyer Strike
191310.description:
From the publisher:
Choose carefully or the enemy will strike! Strategy and suspense collide in this exciting escape game! Advance your Resistance heroes toward safety, but move fast-the Star Destroyer Finalizer is on your tail. The spinning starship of the dreaded First Order can aim in any direction, and you may be in the line of fire! Bounce the beam off the mirrored deflector shield toward your enemies, and evade the surprise laser blasts! It's fast-moving, family fun in a galaxy far, far away!


Choose to play as Resistance or First Order
Use the Deflector to block or redirect the laser
For 2 to 4 players
From the new film, Star Wars: The Force Awakens

191311.name: quizzone
191311.description:
quizzone is a trivia game containing 3.000 questions in 10 categories (Music, Movies & TV, Language & literature, History and religion, Sport and leisure, Art and culture, The world, Society and business, Out and about, Nature and science.

The board is two sided. On one side all 10 categories are in play and have a predefined color. On the other side you choose 6 categories to play with and define their color by placing a token on colored circles.

It is possible to play as individuals or teams - up to 8 in total.

Each player places their token on one of the squares at the rim of the circular board. There must be at least one free space between players.

When the game starts you get a question in the color that you are standing on - if you answer the question correctly you move one space closer to the centre. If you answer incorrectly nothing happens. The winner is the one that reaches the centre first and answers a question of a self chosen category correctly.

Each player receives 4 tactics cards at the start of the game and 2 extra every time you land on a shaded square (though only once in a ring of the board). Normally you can only move directly forward towards the centre but the tcatics cards change this. Some cards let you move a player token of your own chosing back or forward or sideways or even diagonally. Other cards let you answer other players cards, force other players to answer yours or let you choose the category of a question disregarding which color you are currently on. Finally there are cards that override other cards.

If you land on a square where another player already is standing he is sent 2 squares further away from the centre.

191312.name: One Page 40k
191312.description: One Page 40k is a single-paged ruleset designed to be fast to learn and simple to play. It serves as a great introduction to the Warhammer 40.000 universe for people who are new to the game, and as a way to play quick games for veterans of the franchise.

191313.name: quizzone stories
191313.description:
quizzone stories is a trivia game with 100 cards each containing 1 picture and 6 questions. The first question is based around the picture - the next is based on the answer to the first question and so on.

When the game ends can be freely decided and it is therefore a great game to bring on a road trip and the like... The winner is of course the one with the most correct answers.

191314.name: Common Places #15
191314.description:
From publisher blurb:

Common places #015 consists of maps and handouts of HQ of The Honourable Trading Company a famous company whose merchants travel across the world in search of valuables:

The set consists of:

Riverside map (district map);
ground floor plan;
1st floor plan;
2nd floor plan;
a perspective drawing of HQ building.

191315.name: Common Places #18
191315.description:
From publisher blurb:

Common places #018 consists of maps and handouts of Sacred watchtower that guards vast necropolis of Hill of Dead Souls. Each tower is equipped with a blessed bell whose sound can banish lesser undead.:

The set consists of:

Hill of Dead Souls map (district map);
ground floor plan;
1st floor plan;
2nd floor plan;
a perspective drawing of the watchtower.

191316.name: Pentathlon
191316.description:
To win the game, the players have to get each of their 5 meeples in one of the 5 game circles on the board. First the gamemaster rolls a die to determine the aktive circle, which is marked with the white meeple. If a player rolls the same number as the game master, he may place a meeple on any free space of the active circle. On a roll of a 6 the player may place a meele in any circle. The spaces 1 to 4 are safe. Only meeples on a 6-space may be replaced by an opponent meeple. The replaced meeples go to the training center at the bottom of the game board and the players have to perform an athletic task. The training center can only be left on the roll of a 6.

The game Ends, when all players have a meeple in each circle. The player with the highest point count wins the game.

Also included are a soccer game (Fußballspiel) and an athletics game (Leichtathletik).

191317.name: Simon's Dinner Theatre (System Neutral Edition)
191317.description:
From publisher blurb:

The fourth instalment in our Tangible Taverns line is Simon's Dinner Theatre, which details a delightful dinner theatre with fantastic food, is now available in a system neutral format. As always, we have included rumour and event tables, a tavern map, and descriptions of frequent faces about the establishment (which include names, physical features and personalities for the actors). We have also included a table with play titles and descriptions so you can let your players know what their characters are viewing. Instead of just deducting a few gold pieces and letting your PCs regain some spells, give them a chance to explore and interact with the city around them at Simon’s Dinner Theatre.

191318.name: Decahedron (Issue 4 - Jan 2016)
191318.description:
From publisher blurb:

Decahedron is a magazine that contains articles written by gamers like you. It's something we can all develop together and be proud of. Designed to be small, lite, but full of fun content, we hope you enjoy each issue. As long as gamers are contributing, their content will have a place within the pages of Decahedron.

191319.description:
Tattoo! The Game of Ink is a set-making card game of inked body art for 2-4 players where the positioning of the cards matters.

Play as tattoo enthusiasts seeking to have the most Reputation Points when the Design Deck runs out. Use Cash to buy, place, and score Tattoo Designs from the Flash Wall onto your individual Arm Board to gain Reputation Points, and chain similarly Themed designs or play on Prominent Locations for a bonus. You need these points to win the game, but you can also spend them to supplement your Cash and buy bigger and better ink. However, each Arm Board has limited space, so to keep scoring Reputation Points, you'll need to pay Cash to Laser off old designs and score new tattoos.

Tattoo! The Game of Ink features card art from 29 tattoo artists around the country, box and Arm Board art from Nolan Nasser, graphic design by Brian Patterson and Robert LeBlanc, and is being published by Gaming Paper LLC.
191319.name: Tattoo! The Game of Ink

191320.name: Demon Storyteller Guide
191320.description:
From publisher blurb:

Does the mouse in the maze think:

“Today I shall try a different route. Go left instead of right. Chew through a wall. Refuse to run.”?

Does it? I think not.

I think the mouse runs because it only knows the maze. It follows the corridors like a charge following a circuit.

It knows all routes lead to the same end.

You know it, too. You left, but you’ll come back. This is your end”.

- The Triptych, Messenger Angel

The Demon Storyteller’s Guide includes:

Expanded information on angels, including a look at how Incarnations apply to them
A extensive look at the spy genre and its permutations and how they apply to Demon
Three “setting hacks,” including an examination of Demon in the Bronze Age

191321.name: BASH! Fantasy: Codex of Fantasy Folk
191321.description:
From publisher blurb:

The BASH! Fantasy: Codex of Fantasy Folk is designed to allow you to do two things. First, we have provided dozens of examples of fantasy species that can inhabit your fantasy worlds using BASH! Fantasy, either as playable Heroes or for the Narrator to use for NPCs and Villains. These fantasy folk range from the stock elves and dwarves common to western fantasy fiction, to more modern and rare tropes of the genre, such as the dragonkin or cathulian. Some of these species may even be more traditionally associated with being antagonists to heroes (such as orcs, goblins, snakemen, or kobolds) but here we present the various species as not being inherently good nor evil, but perhaps motivated by conflicting goals. You can take or leave this backstory text as you see fit, of course, and just use the mechanical content if you like.

Our second task was to give you the tools and inspiration to create new species of your own. If you don’t see the species you want for your game in these pages, you can create new ones of your own. Here you will find some information on species specific Weaknesses, Advantages, Disadvantages, and a few new powers as well.

Fantasy Folk featured in this Codex include:

Human - The standard by which all others are compared.
Hybrid - You can make half one species and half another
Angelkin - Descended from the divine
Birdkin - Fine feathered folk
Bouda - Hyena folk
Catfolk - Humanoid felines
Cathulian – Squid-like humanoids from the subterranean deep
Centaur - Humanoids with the lower body of a horse
Demonkin - People with infernal ancestry
Dhampir - People with a vampire parent
Dragonkin - Descended from dragons
Dwarf - Stout and dependable folk from beneath the mountains
Elf - Woodland descendants of the fey
Flamekin - Humanoids with elemental flame in their veins
The Forged - Magical machine-men manufactured by cathulians
Frogkin - Hopping good swimmers and jumpers
Gargoyle - Flesh and blood creatures with ties to the earth
Giantkin - Descended from giants
Goblin - Little green folk with a gift for gab
Gnome - Tiny fey with a knack for invention
Halfling - Small folk who try not to be late for dinner
Kobold - Small miners with strong ties to earth
Lizardkin - Reptilian humanoids of the swamps
Minotaur - Legendary humanoid bovines
Naga - Charming and magical snake folk
Orc - A proud and strong warrior people from underground
Pixie - Tiny flying fey most at home in the woods
Packfolk - Humanoid wolves, coyotes, and jackals
Ratkin - Humanoid rats with a predilection to purloin
Skykin - Humanoids with infused with elemental air
Snakemen - An ancient species that once ruled the world
Stonekin - Humanoids of elemental earth
Troll - The more sophisticated cousins of the "Cave Troll"
Ursine - Bear folk with a love for battle... and honey
Wavekin- Humanoids with watery elemental origins

191322.description:
A space program game but with a veeery low budget. You are entrusted with a task to explore space and expand a world of beerlings!You'll hire a team of "extremly talanted" beerlings build a spaceship from scra... from different parts and go in space and even found a colony and maybe if you are really luck... skillful discover alien life.

A game of space exploration and colony management for 2-4 players. At the beginning of the game players deside turn order by rolling dice, then build a space ship from different junk by buying ship tiles of different tiers from stack (cards) with their starting budget which is veeery limited, after this players generate their "heroic" crew by blind drawing trait tokens. After this every player decide the destination by choosing a planet, gas giant or asteroid on a map and try to fly their ship to the chosen destination to found a colony or space station and then manage it. During flight a lot of different events will happen (card drawing) and players will try to deal with them by moving astranaut tokens to the ship tile-event location and roll dice. The time of the program is limited by the total number of turns. And the goal of the game is to survive and make their space program successful by getting the highest amount of points at the end of the game (for every astronaut alive, every module standing and every token of resources) while every turn everything goes wron....to hell.
191322.name: Low Budget Colonists

191323.name: Super Impossible Road
191323.description:
SUPER IMPOSSIBLE ROAD is a futuristic racing game about shortcuts.

The only way to get ahead is by taking huge leaps across the roller coaster-like speedway. These risky overtaking manoeuvres can take you straight into the lead, or drop you mercilessly into the void.

Source: The Game Website.

191324.name: Talismanoj
191324.description:
Talismanoj is a 2-player card game (with cards and rules in Esperanto) in which each player draws from their own deck and plays cards to create two sets of 3 cards (each set must share a common attribute but have different colors) and a legend card, while surviving attacks by the opponent which can remove their previously played cards. Combat is resolved by playing cards from one's battle reserve (where the cards must have been previously placed in anticipation).

The 2 player decks have different themes and art: one deck has a "Don Quixote" theme (with Gustave Doré art) and the other deck has various Esperanto authors ("Verdaj Donkiĥotoj").

With multiple sets, it is possible to play with more than 2 players.

191325.name: EDOM Field Manual
191325.description:
[publisher blurb]
Drink from the chalice, and join the ranks of the unseen immortals.
You’re on the inside now.

You know what must be done to defend Queen and Country, to defend everything we’ve built, everything we stand for. You deserve access to the innermost sanctum, and this is your key – the EDOM FIELD MANUAL. It will tell you everything you need to know about Operation Edom – what we do, how we do it, and what we’re working towards. It will also teach you how to handle our special assets, and how to put them down if they go rogue.

For more than a century, the top-secret operation within MI6 codenamed ‘Edom’ has defended the United Kingdom from the machinations of the Un-Dead. This book describes the operation’s history, methods, and tradecraft, initiating you into the innermost secrets of the British vampire program.

For players – create your own Edom officers and hunt vampires with the sanction and backing of the British government! Immerse yourself in the clandestine world with eyes-only documents and briefings. Call on Dukes for aid and counsel, gather intel with the aid of Edom’s networks of informants, and gear up with specialised anti-vampire weapons and tactics. Use the Fields of Edom campaign frame to play the spies hunting for the stolen Dracula Dossier, or defy your masters and complete the original mission by taking Dracula down for good.

For Directors – Build your own Edom with a guide to the operation’s structure and methods. Two dozen non-player characters give you a supporting cast for Edom-centred games. Explore Edom’s secret history and render its shadowy present in vivid detail. Advice and campaign options help you bring the operation to a thrilling conclusion – or a bloody catastrophe.

So watch for the cup-and-blaze mark and the hand signal. Keep your kukri close, and remember your training. Four generations of agents have passed the cup on to you – do not falter at the last!

The Edom Field Manual stands alone as a guide to a vampire hunting program. Combine it with the other books in the Dracula Dossier series for insight into Edom its machinations.

191326.name: Clear Ether! (Vol 2, No 15 - Sep 1976)

rpgissuearticle.170747: En Garde at the Riposte Office

191326.description:
Clear Ether!
Volume 2, Number 15

191328.description: This is a third-party expansion with additional scenarios for the Check Your 6! air combat miniatures game. The book contains over 140 historical scenarios covering a variety of theaters, including air action over the Western Front, Eastern Front, Malta, and the Pacific. In addition, there are some supplementary and house rules included in the book.

191329.name: Clear Ether! (Vol 2, No 17 - Nov 1976)

Note - colophon mistakenly states Number 18

Includes historically significant discussion/proposal on an "alignment" system with an orthogonal graph, planar names, and symbols.

191339.name: Crazy Belts
191339.description:
Did you know that more than 25.000.000 bags are mishandled in airports in the World every year?. Did you ever wonder what’s happen after check in? See what’s goes on behind the scenes !!! Get Crazy Belts!

Source: The Developer Website.

191340.name: Clear Ether! (Vol 2, No 27 - Jul 1977)
