Créatures et règles sur les créatures.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Creatures and creatures rules.

191457.name: Minidonjon: Variantes de Classes
191457.description:
From publisher blurb:

Classes et pouvoirs optionnels.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Classes and elective powers.

191458.name: Minidonjon: Options Modernes
191458.description:
From publisher blurb:

Classes et pouvoirs modernes ou futuristes.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Classes, modern and futuristic powers.

191459.name: Minidonjon: Space Opera
191459.description:
From publisher blurb:

Moines-chevaliers et vaisseaux.


Translation:

Monk-knights and spaceships.

191460.name: Minidonjon Module 1: Chute de Nécropole
191460.description:
From publisher blurb:

Module d'aventure pour Minidonjon.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Adventure module for Minidonjon.

191461.name: Minidonjon M1: Par delà les Marches abandonnées
191461.description:
From publisher blurb:

Un petit module bac-à-sable pour Minidonjon, le hack minimaliste du Grand Ancêtre™, par Nolendur. Livré avec quatre prétirés.


Translation courtesy of Google:

A small module tray to sand Mini Dungeon, minimalist hack the Great Ancestor ™ by Nolendur. Comes with four preprints.

rpg.33312: DicePunk: Cinematic Roleplaying In The Now

191462.name: DicePunk System Reference Document
191462.description:
From publisher blurb:

The DicePunk System is a free roleplaying game: this is its slightly-less-free hardcopy System Reference Document, with all the rules you need to launch your own DicePunk System games.

The DicePunk System is a fast-paced, “rules light” RPG designed by and for people who grew up on, eat, sleep, breathe, and speak movies. The DicePunk System spins cinematic stories that take place more or less in the real world and more or less in the present day. If you could imagine your RPG campaign as a movie directed by Quentin Tarantino, Robert Rodriguez or the Coen Brothers, DicePunk is the game for you.

Generates characters fast, fast, fast. Character generation usually takes five to ten minutes for experts, and a half hour or so for newbies.
Core mechanics are simple and easy to grasp, but enough options exist for moderate to high tactical depth in combat.
Fights are fast and visceral, with small skirmishes easily resolved in half an hour, and even bigger battles (within reason) typically going down in an hour or less.
No set character classes, so every character is that much more unique.
Rules allow for the easy creation of custom skills, allowing players to define exactly the character they want mechanically and narratively.

191463.description:
Defenders of the Realm: Hero Expansion #5 includes three new heroes – with a miniature and character card for each hero. The new heroes introduced in this expansion are:


Eliana the Centaur: Eliana's body allows her to move more quickly as a horse and her strength gives her bonuses in combat.



Captain William the Mariner: Captain William uses the sea to help him travel faster across locations that are connected by water.



Bartholomew the Bard: Bartholomew uses the power of song and poetry to give him special advantages in combat.
191463.name: Defenders of the Realm: Hero Expansion #5

191464.description: Defenders of the Realm: Hero Expansion #6 doesn't actually include any playable heroes, but instead comes with the miniature, placard, and cards needed to call on Sterling, the three-headed silver dragon guardian of the realm, and ally to the heroes.
191464.name: Defenders of the Realm: Sterling, Guardian Dragon of the Realm

191465.name: Dark Places of the Dominions
191465.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome back to the Dominions! This sourcebook is about the most important part of any adventure: locations.

Among these pages you will find a number of detailed, ready-to-play mysterious places of the Dread Sea Dominions, each of them ripe with interesting opportunities (and terrible dangers) for the heroes, which you can use in your campaign.
An Instant Plot is also given for each of them, a pre-made idea to use it as a no-prep, stand-alone adventure.

So grab your sword, check your bow and venture into the Dominions again!

191466.name: Jaunt Through the Woods
191466.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Provincia series continues with the fourth adventure in the series “Jaunt through the Woods” After successfully exploring the Ruins of Tobrick your intrepid adventurers continue their path north to warn the residents of Queen’s Point of the humanoid gathering. While attempting to circumvent the evil army they will have to continue through the forest using old trails. Along the way a collection of encounters gives the party multiple opportunities to enhance their skills!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Provincia Campaign for a group of 4-6 adventurers that are level 2-4. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for several one shot adventures or a continuing campaign setting!

191467.name: The Flame in the Flood

videogamehonor.33347: 2015 SXSW Best Indie Game of the Year Nominee

191467.description:
The only companion that the player will have will be a dog called Aesop, who can sense danger and fetch supplies. The player must pay attention to Scout's needs such as her energy, thirst, and warmth, and not paying attention to them can result in death. Once the player dies, the death cannot be undone. There will be a crafting system allowing the player to create new items. They will also need to scavenge areas for valuable items. Factors such as the weather will impact the gameplay.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Flame in the Flood", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

191468.name: That Dragon, Cancer

videogamehonor.33347: 2015 SXSW Best Indie Game of the Year Nominee

191468.description:
The game is based on the Greens' emotional experiences of raising their son Joel, who was diagnosed with terminal cancer at twelve months old, and though only given a short time to live, continued to survive for four more years before eventually succumbing to the cancer in March 2014. The game is designed to have the player experience the low and high moments of this period, using the video game medium to provide more interactivity and immersion for the Greens' to relate their tale that a film cannot. Alongside the game, a documentary Thank You for Playing, documenting both the last few years of Joel's life and the development of the game, has been filmed to be aired in 2016.

Source: Wikipedia, "That Dragon, Cancer", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

191469.name: Flori Vielfraß
191469.description:
In Flori Vielfraß, players want to get their caterpillar to the finish line quicker than anyone else. The finish line is made of food, after all, which means that you'll fill up first and turn into a butterfly before your friends!

To play, each player takes the head of a caterpillar and three differently colored wooden half-spheres to create the body. They line up their caterpillars, then place additional half-spheres upside down as food at different lengths on the table, with the final row of food equalling the finish line.

On a turn, a player rolls the three color dice up to three times, keeping whichever dice they want after each throw. At the end of their turn, all players who have the colors showing on their dice at the back of their caterpillar move those pieces to the front instead. Progress! Reach a piece of food, and you lengthen your entire body. Whoever reaches the finish line first wins!

191470.name: A Bad Day for Donuts
191470.description:
Bake your donuts and send them off to battle to the death. Which baker can rise to the occasion and reach the sweet sweet taste of victory!

During a turn in A Bad Day for Donuts, draw two donut cards, select the best donut to bake and send out onto the game board, then roll to reposition your donuts on the game board and initiate donut fights against enemy pastries (other player's donuts). Play out the fights with dice and use stored-up advantages at key moments to give you that edge in battle.

Each donut has a "baker's point" value that is collected by the winner at the end of a donut fight if that donut no longer stands. Collect a baker's dozen of points to win!

A Bad Day for Donuts will be launching on Kickstarter March 3rd, 2016!!!

191471.name: White Lies
191471.description:
White Lies is simple. Randomly pick a stone (don't show anyone the color).
White stone? You must lie.
Black stone? You must tell the truth.
Now take a card:
"Show the group your foot, then tell them your shoe size."
"Tell the group about a scar on your body and how you got it."
"What's the best trick you can currently perform on a trampoline?"
Who lies? Who tells the truth? Be the first to guess, and win.
Let the best lie detector win!

191472.name: Fionna Fights
191472.description:
User Summary

A tie-in game for the Adventure Time cartoon. Quite a short mobile game where you control Fionna (the female version of Finn) as she flies through the air slicing through various enemies from the show and gathering power-ups before running out of energy.

There is an alternate game mode where you can play as Finn (called Finn fights). The same game but with Finn and a few cosmetic differences to the power-ups.

191473.name: Speed Dice
191473.description:
In Speed Dice, players want to create words quickly from the letters that they roll on their dice.

To set up, each player takes eight letter dice in a single color; place the box with the dice funnel in the center of the playing area. In a round, all players roll their eight dice, then race to use exactly seven of them to create a single word or two words connected crossword-style.

Once they do this, they throw their final die into the box. If their die lands at the bottom of the funnel, they take the trophy disc (from the side of the table or from an opponent) and place it silver side up. If the player who won already has the silver trophy, they flip it to the gold side. If the player who won already has the gold trophy, then they win the game!

191474.name: Savage Spirits
191474.description:
From the publisher's website:

The Star Wars galaxy is an immense realm, filled with more unexplored regions than civilized areas. Some Force users are compelled by destiny to explore the galaxy’s vastness and dwell in its wildernesses, existing in tune with the ever-shifting Living Force. These independent, nomadic Force users are known as Seekers, and tend to live by their own rules. Savage Spirits, a sourcebook for the Star Wars: Force and Destiny roleplaying game, is designed to guide Seekers and all those who venture into the wild.

Within its 96 full-color pages, players will find everything necessary for wilderness survival. In addition to Seeker specializations and signature abilities, Savage Spirits introduces copious amounts of survival and medical gear, expanded rules for wilderness settings, and a new Force power, Farsight, that enables PCs to see at great distances even when their eyes cannot. A beastiary is included that introduces numerous creatures to the Force and Destiny system, and offers Game Masters outlines for Seeker-focused adventures and campaigns.

191475.description:
The trick-taking game Wizard uses a sixty-card deck that consists of the traditional 52-card deck (1-13 in four suits) along with four Wizards (high) and four Jesters (low).

Players compete over multiple rounds based on the number of players, and whoever ends with the highest score wins. In each round, players are dealt a hand of cards — one card in the first round, two cards in the second, three in the third, etc. — then trump is determined by flipping the top card of the undealt deck; if a suit is revealed, that suit is trump, while if a Wizard or Jester (or no card in the final round) is revealed, then the round has no trump. Players then state how many tricks they expect to win in the round.

The playing and winning of the tricks uses mostly standard trick-taking rules. If a player leads a suited card, then all other players must follow suit, if possible. If a player leads a Jester, then the second player determines the suit led. If a player leads a Wizard, then those who follow can play whatever they want. However, in all cases a player may always play a Wizard or Jester, even if they hold cards in the suit led.

After each player has played a card, determine the winner of the trick as follows: If one or more Wizards were played, the player of the first Wizard wins the trick, collects the cards, and leads to the next trick. If not, whoever played the highest trump wins the trick. If not, whoever played the highest card of the suit led wins the trick. If all players played Jesters, whoever played the first Jester wins.

After all tricks have been played, players tally their score for the round. If a player matched their bid, winning exactly as many tricks as stated at the start of the round, they score 20 points, plus 10 points for each trick taken. If a player missed their bid, they lose 10 points for each trick that they were off, whether they took more or fewer than predicted.

A common variant in Wizard is to not allow the total number of tricks bid in a round to match the round number, thereby forcing (at least) one player to be off each round.

Wizard: 20th Jubiläumsedition is a special edition of Wizard that includes six cards not present in the normal game, including a single dragon card that beats a Wizard, a four-colored 7-1/2 Juggler card, and a bomb card that negates the bids for the round, with players then scoring points based on the total number of tricks they take.
191475.name: Wizard: Jubiläumsedition

191476.name: Capital Combat
191476.description:
What does it take to run a successful modern battle machine? Funding!

Capital Combat is an interactive play-set that brings epic capitalistic combat action to your kitchen table. Money management concepts are blended with tactical battle skills to create a unique playing experience that develops critical, decisive and strategic thinking for both kids and adults alike.

Out-of-the-box, Capital Combat is fun and easy to learn. Using a blend of cards, dice, and toy componentry, players’ wits are matched against one another with the goal to eliminate the opponent.

191478.name: Ice Cult
191478.description:
Ice Cult is an eye-catching brain teaser for up to four tacticians.

Four transparent cubes made from acrylic plastic with icons on them are the heart of the game. On a player's turn, they first rotate two cubes 90º two times; to do this, you sandwich two cubes with your fingers, pick them up to rotate them, then place them back in the holder. You can rotate the same pair of cubes twice or two different pairs.

After rotating the cubes, the player moves the corresponding playing pieces — no matter to whom they belong! — according to the symbols now on top of the cubes along four racing tracks. Note that everyone is able to move everybody's playing pieces, and since the playing pieces can give each other "piggyback rides", you have to be clever to make the right moves at the right time in order to move all of your own playing pieces off the ice first.

191479.name: Airship Map Pack
191479.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Have you finally scraped together enough to purchase your own airship, or has your party stowed away because they could not afford passage across the great ocean? Have the sky pirates kidnapped the princess and you must fight your way through their ranks? Do the buccaneers who man the ship plan to rob all the passengers—you included? With D20 Cartographer, the story is in your hands!

"Fantasy Maps" are full-featured encounter maps designed to fit any traditional fantasy world. This release, "Airship" features a marritime-inspired sky-vessel, including the deck, and four inner levels including the captain and first mate's cabin, gunnery, cargo hold, and more! Fly the not-so-friendly skies with ample room for fencing, fighting and general swashbuckling. Just hope you won't have to walk the plank! All maps are in the traditional 1 inch = 5 feet scale.

Included for your convenience are several different formats including:

• Full-color maps in .jpg format
• High-contrast black and white maps in .jpg format
• PDF files with images sliced up over multiple pages for easy home-printing (compatible with both US Letter and A4 International paper)

D20 Cartographer also supports virtual table top (VTT) systems and includes:

• 100 DPI gridless map with objects removed
• A folder with all ‘objects' in .png format for use on this map or reuse on your private maps
• An RPTools MapTool VTT file (.cmpgn) with vision blocking and object layer set up for you

191480.name: Lightning Train Map Pack
191480.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Has the the lightning train been waylaid by hijackers? Are train robbers waiting quietly in the first-class cabin for the opportune time to strike? Have the lightning elementals that power the engine broken free to exact revenge for their forced servitude? Ready for a tense showdown on the roof while great bolts of electricity arc all around? With D20 Cartographer, the story is in your hands!

"Fantasy Maps" are full-featured encounter maps designed to fill your fantastic world! This release, "Lightning Train" features a massive lightning-powered locomotive, including eleven fully-mapped train cars, inside and out. Will players be traveling first class, standard, or steerage? Whether your party is having dinner with the captain in the ballroom, mixing with shady characters in the on-board tavern, making a grand assault on the cargo hold, or having an epic battle on the roofs, it is all possible on this massive map. Print all the cars for a massive train line, or only the cars you need. All maps are in typical 1 inch = 5 feet scale.

Included for your convenience are several different formats including:
• Full-color maps of each car (both rooftop and inside) in individual .jpg files (versions with and without grid)
• Printer-friendly, high-contrast black and white map in individual .jpg files (versions with and without grid)
• PDF files with images sliced up over multiple pages for easy home-printing (Color and Black&White, compatible with both US Letter and A4 International paper)

D20 Cartographer also supports virtual table top (VTT) systems and includes:
• 100 DPI gridless maps with objects and dungeon dressing removed
• A folder with all ‘objects' (over 50!) in .png format for use on this map or reuse on your private maps
• An RPTools MapTool VTT file with vision blocking and object layer set up for you

191481.name: Galleon
191481.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Have you waylaid a massive galleon and taken it for your own? Has your party booked passage to the new world? Are you the muscle hired to protect the ship if it is attacked by pirates, or worse, the kraken? What dark obsession does the captain have, and will it lure the whole crew to their demise? With D20 Cartographer, the story is in your hands!

Fantasy Maps are full-featured encounter maps designed to fill your fantastic world! This release, Galleon, features a massive ship including upper deck, captain and crew cabins, two gun decks, a cargo hold, infirmary, galley, and dining room. About 130 feet long with a compliment of forty guns, the Galleon is truly a titan at sea! All campaigns involve travel at one time or another: make it more exciting with encounters on one of the largest and most glorious ships from the Age of Sails! All maps are in typical 1 inch = 5 feet scale.

Included for your convenience are several different formats including:

• Full-color maps in .jpg format (with and withour grid)
• High-contrast black and white maps in .jpg format
• PDF files with images sliced up over multiple pages for easy home-printing (compatible with both US Letter and A4 International paper)

D20 Cartographer also supports virtual table top (VTT) systems and includes:

• 100 DPI gridless map with objects removed
• A folder with all ‘objects' in .png format for use on this map or reuse on your private maps
• An RPTools MapTool VTT file (.cmpgn) with vision blocking and object layer set up for you

191482.name: Graveyard and Church Map Pack
191482.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

What evil lurks in the graveyard that is causing the bodies of dead to reanimate? Who is responsible for the evil, the dirty grave keeper in his small hovel or the pious holy-men in their country church? Has an innocent child become lost in the catacombs beneath the mausoleum, or have filthy grave-robbers moved in with an eye on plunder? With D20 Cartographer, the story is in your hands!

"Fantasy Maps" are full-featured encounter maps designed to fit any traditional fantasy world. This release, "Graveyard and Church" is a massive 48 in. x 36 in. encounter-scale map which includes six additional indoor maps for the included structures: a 3-story church complete with bell-tower, a grave keeper's shack, a mausoleum, and a subterranean crypt! All maps are in the traditional 1 inch = 5 feet scale.

Included for your convenience are several different formats including:

• Full-color maps in .jpg format
• High-contrast black and white maps in .jpg format
• PDF files with images sliced up over multiple pages for easy home-printing (compatible with both US Letter and A4 International paper)

D20 Cartographer also supports virtual table top (VTT) systems and includes:

• 100 DPI gridless map with objects removed
• A folder with all ‘objects' in .png format for use on this map or reuse on your private maps
• An RPTools MapTool VTT file (.cmpgn) with vision blocking and object layer set up for you

191483.name: Magical Research Facility Map Pack
191483.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Has the mage’s guild lost touch with their research outpost and sent you to check in? Did you join the wizard’s college and get placed in a dorm with several shady characters? Is your party researching rumors of a newly discovered spell that opens gateways to other dimensions? With D20 Cartographer, the story is in your hands!

Fantasy Maps are full-featured encounter maps designed to fill your fantastic world! This release, Magical Research Facility, features a two-story structure with an alchemy lab, spell testing room, dorm, storage units, and a second floor summoning/binding circle. With cozy furnishings for the resident mages, this can be the site of an information-gathering mission, a close-quarters combat encounter, or an opportunity to steal rare and expensive reagents. All maps are in typical 1 inch = 5 feet scale.

Included for your convenience are several different formats including:

• Full-color map in .jpg format
• High-contrast black and white map in .jpg format
• PDF files with images sliced up over multiple pages for easy home-printing (compatible with both US Letter and A4 International paper)

D20 Cartographer also supports virtual table top (VTT) systems and includes:

• 100 DPI gridless map with objects removed
• A folder with all ‘objects' in .png format for use on this map or reuse on your private maps
• An RPTools MapTool VTT file (.cmpgn) with vision blocking and object layer set up for you

191484.name: Cistern Map Pack
191484.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Has the city’s water supply been compromised by monstrous vermin? Has a sinister wizard poisoned the underground cistern? Have you cornered the escaped prisoner in the wet, filthy, underground tunnels of the city? With D20 Cartographer, the story is in your hands!

“Fantasy Maps” are full-featured encounter maps designed to fill your fantastic world! This release, “Cistern” features underground channels designed to water a city. Including several chambers and choke points for strategic, close-quarters combat, the Cistern Map Pack allows for flexible storytelling. Will the players save the city? Kill the infestation? Poison the enemy empire? Quash the sorcerer’s plans? All D20 Cartographer maps are in typical 1 inch = 5 feet scale.

Included for your convenience are several different formats including:

• Full-color map in .jpg format
• High-contrast black and white map in .jpg format
• PDF files with images sliced up over multiple pages for easy home-printing (compatible with both US Letter and A4 International paper)

D20 Cartographer also supports virtual table top (VTT) systems and includes:

• 100 DPI gridless map with objects removed
• A folder with all ‘objects' in .png format for use on this map or reuse on your private maps
• An RPTools MapTool VTT file (.cmpgn) with vision blocking and object layer set up for you

191485.name: Lighthouse and Dock Map Pack
191485.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Is the lighthouse a beachhead for the invading band of pirates? Did a roving group of kobolds take shelter in the tower during a storm and now refuse to leave? Has a master marksman barricaded the door, attempting to pick off the party from the upper level without ever letting them get close? Ready for a swashbuckling battle up the spiral staircase in dramatic fashion? With D20 Cartographer, the story is in your hands!

Fantasy Maps are full-featured encounter maps designed to fit any traditional fantasy world. This release, Lighthouse and Dock features a five-story lighthouse, mapped both inside and out, near a small dock on the beach. With cozy furnishings for a resident lighthouse keeper, this can be the site of a information-gathering mission or a tricky, multi-level combat encounter in close quarters. All maps are in typical 1 inch = 5 feet scale.

Included for your convenience are several different formats including:

• Full-color maps in .jpg format
• High-contrast black and white maps in .jpg format
• PDF files with images sliced up over multiple pages for easy home-printing (compatible with both US Letter and A4 International paper)

D20 Cartographer also supports virtual table top (VTT) systems and includes:

• 100 DPI gridless map with objects removed
• A folder with all ‘objects' in .png format for use on this map or reuse on your private maps
• An RPTools MapTool VTT file (.cmpgn) with vision blocking and object layer set up for you

191486.name: Bank Map Pack
191486.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Are you at the bank to make a deposit, or a withdrawal-of the illegal kind? Is the bank manager subjecting the poor mining town to exorbitant interest rates, and you've come to "talk some sense into him"? Have you caught wind of a black hat's plot to blow the bank sky-high with dynamite, thereby eliminating his debts? With D20 Cartographer, the story is in your hands!

"Western Maps" are full-featured encounter maps designed for Wild West campaigns. This release, "Bank" features a 45 ft. by 35 ft. financial institution, both inside and out, including four tellers' windows in the lobby, a manager's office, a room full of safe deposit boxes, and of course a vault with sacks of cash! All maps are in typical 1 inch = 5 feet scale

Included for your convenience are several different formats including:
• Full-color maps in individual .jpg files (versions with and without grid)
• Printer-friendly, high-contrast black and white maps in individual .jpg files (versions with and without grid)
• PDF files with images sliced up over multiple pages for easy home-printing (Color and Black&White, compatible with both US Letter and A4 International paper)

D20 Cartographer also supports virtual table top (VTT) systems and includes:
• 100 DPI gridless maps with objects and dungeon dressing removed
• A folder with all ‘objects' in .png format for use on this map or reuse on your private maps
• An RPTools MapTool VTT file with vision blocking and object layer set up for you (included macros for automatic transitions and roof transparencies require latest MapTool Build)

191487.name: Brothel Map Pack
191487.description:
From the publisher's blurb:
Has a brawl broken out over a card game? Is a liquored up patron of the brothel causing trouble? Has the murder in one of the cramped rooms invited your investigation? Do the hookers need help defending the brothel from a raiding party of bandits? With D20 Cartographer, the story is in your hands!

"Western Maps" are full-featured encounter maps designed for Wild West campaigns. This release, "Brothel" features a two-story brothel, mapped both inside and out, including a bar, a backroom for poker, a lounge, and three bedrooms where the 'employees' practice their trade! All maps are in typical 1 inch = 5 feet scale

Included for your convenience are several different formats including:
• Full-color maps in individual .jpg files (versions with and without grid)
• Printer-friendly, high-contrast black and white maps in individual .jpg files (versions with and without grid)
• PDF files with images sliced up over multiple pages for easy home-printing (Color and Black&White, compatible with both US Letter and A4 International paper)

D20 Cartographer also supports virtual table top (VTT) systems and includes:
• 100 DPI gridless maps with objects and dungeon dressing removed
• A folder with all ‘objects' in .png format for use on this map or reuse on your private maps
• An RPTools MapTool VTT file with vision blocking and object layer set up for you (included macros for automatic transitions and roof transparencies require latest MapTool Build)

191488.name: General Store Map Pack
191488.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Does the party happen to be buying parts for their wagon just as a robbery takes place? Does the kindly shop owner seem nervous, indicating with his body language that murderous bandits are hiding upstairs? Are you stocking up for a long journey to hunt a bounty, but the criminal has decided to strike you first? Is the town under attack by pistol-weilding zombies? With D20 Cartographer, the story is in your hands!

"Western Maps" are full-featured encounter maps designed for Wild West campaigns. This release, "General Store" features a two-story shop, mapped both inside and out, including the first floor store area and the second floor shop owner's home! All maps are in typical 1 inch = 5 feet scale. Use the exterior as set dressing for a main strip, or feature an encounter inside the crowded shop!

Included for your convenience are several different formats including:
• Full-color map in an individual .jpg file (versions with and without grid)
• Printer-friendly, high-contrast black and white map in an individual .jpg file (versions with and without grid)
• PDF files with images sliced up over multiple pages for easy home-printing (Color and Black&White, compatible with both US Letter and A4 International paper)

D20 Cartographer also supports virtual table top (VTT) systems and includes:
• 100 DPI gridless map with objects and dungeon dressing removed
• A folder with all ‘objects' in .png format for use on this map or reuse on your private maps
• An RPTools MapTool VTT file with vision blocking and object layer set up for you (included macros for automatic transitions and roof transparencies require latest MapTool Build)

191489.name: Sheriff's Office and Jail Map Pack
191489.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Has the party been deputized to run the town in the Sheriff's stead? Is there a break-in to the sheriff's office or a break-out from the prison? Does the psychopathic prisoner in solitary confinement have the information you need to stop the advancing soldiers? Is it time for a good, old-fashioned hanging? With D20 Cartographer, the story is in your hands!

"Western Maps" are full-featured encounter maps designed for Wild West campaigns. This release, "Sheriff's Office and Jail" features a sheriff's office and jail, mapped both inside and out, and a two person gallows! All maps are in typical 1 inch = 5 feet scale

Included for your convenience are several different formats including:
• Full-color maps in individual .jpg files (versions with and without grid)
• Printer-friendly, high-contrast black and white maps in individual .jpg files (versions with and without grid)
• PDF files with images sliced up over multiple pages for easy home-printing (Color and Black&White, compatible with both US Letter and A4 International paper)

D20 Cartographer also supports virtual table top (VTT) systems and includes:
• 100 DPI gridless maps with objects and dungeon dressing removed
• A folder with all ‘objects' in .png format for use on this map or reuse on your private maps
• An RPTools MapTool VTT file with vision blocking and object layer set up for you (included macros for automatic transitions and roof transparencies require latest MapTool Build)

191490.name: Cleric's Cathedral Map Pack

rpgseries.33351: One Dollar Dungeons by D20 Cartographer

191490.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Have the local clergy gone mad with power, turning to dark forces to aid them in their concquest of the city? Is a goblin warband reading themselves for an assault on the cathedral, and only you stand in the way of the slaughter? Have you been forced to take sanctuary in in this massive structure until the whole murder charge thing blows over? With D20 Cartographer, the story is in your hands!

"Cleric's Cathedral" is the first in a series of One Dollar Dungeons maps which represent convenient starting points or class-specific locals for each of traditional RPG character class. The Cleric's Cathedral is a massive 165' x 130' structure, with attached catacombs, laid out in the typical 1 in. = 5 ft. map format.

Included for your convenience are several different formats:
- Full color map in a single .jpg (versions with and without grid)
- High contrast black and white map in a single .jpg (great for printing on parchment textured paper)
- PDF of the sliced images for your home printer, compatible with US Letter and A4 size paper

D20 Cartographer also supports Virtual Table Top systems and includes:
- 100DPI gridless .jpg mapwith objects removed
- Objects in .png format for use on this map or reuse in your private maps
- An RPTools MapTool VTT file (.rpmap) with vision blocking and object layer set up for you

191491.name: Fighter's Barroom Brawl Map Pack

rpgseries.33351: One Dollar Dungeons by D20 Cartographer

191491.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Has the owner gotten tired of the frequent fights and hired you as a bouncer? Think you have what it takes to beat the best in the nightly drinking contest? Come to glean information from the shadowy figure at the private table in the back? Or, like most patrons, are you just there to get rowdy and knock some teeth in? With D20 Cartographer, the story is in your hands!

Fighter's Barroom Brawl is the second in a series of One Dollar Dungeon maps, which represent convenient starting locations or class-specific adventure locals for each traditional RPG character class. Fighter‘s Barroom Brawl is a rough-and-tumble tavern and inn so you can have access to your beds and your booze in one place! The taproom and inn features two floors and a cellar mapped out in typical 1 in. = 5 ft. map format.


Included for your convenience are several different formats including:

- Full color map in a single .jpg (versions with and without grid)
- High contrast black and white map in a single .jpg (great for printing on parchment textured paper)
- PDF of the sliced images for your home printer, compatible with US Letter and A4 size paper
D20 Cartographer also supports Virtual Table Top systems and includes:

- 100DPI gridless .jpg map with objects removed
- Objects in .png format for use on this map or reuse on your private maps
- An RPTools MapTool VTT file (.rpmap) with vision blocking and object layer set up for you and lots of neat tricks like chairs, tables, and barstools set up with macros so you can flip them over from anger or for cover with one click, candles that light or extinguish with a single button press, and spillable beers--the perfect reason to start a fistfight!

191492.name: Wizard's Weird Tower of Wonders Map Pack

rpgseries.33351: One Dollar Dungeons by D20 Cartographer

191492.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Have you come to pillage the lair of the mad mage? Are you an apprentice to a powerful wizard who must take care of the elemental infestation running loose in the tower? Have you finally finished construction of your mighty wizard's spire? With D20 Cartographer, the story is in your hands!

Wizard's Weird Tower of Wonders is the third in a series of One Dollar Dungeons maps, which represent convenient starting locations or class-specific adventure locals for each traditional RPG character class. The tower is a seven story structure of truly epic proportions. The first floor is the grand entrance with a mysterious glowing sigil in the center of the tower, and a cozy living space including a greenhouse area, library, office and bedroom. The second floor features a grand ballroom-the perfect place to be struck with an Otto's Irresistible Dance trap. The next four levels are elemental-themed: The peaceful garden (earth) the moist grotto (water) the shocking Aerie (wind) and the fiery furnace (fire)! And the final story, the rooftop ramparts, is the perfect cinematic scene to confront any archmage! The tower is mapped out in typical 1 in. = 5 ft. map format.

This is a very big map. You may alternately, use this to build a smaller, 3-story structure without the elemental floors by printing only the 1st, 2nd, and roof levels.

Included for your convenience are several different formats including:

- Full color maps in individual .jpg files (versions with and without grid)
- High contrast black and white maps in individual .jpg files (great for printing on parchment textured paper)
- Easy-print PDF files with the map sliced up into multiple pages for your home printer, compatible with US Letter and A4 size paper

D20 Cartographer also supports Virtual Table Top systems and includes:

- 100DPI gridless .jpg with objects removed
- Objects in .png format for use on this map or reuse on your private maps
- An RPTools MapTool VTT file (.rpmap) with vision blocking and object layer set up for you

191493.name: Rogue's Reward Prison Map Pack

rpgseries.33351: One Dollar Dungeons by D20 Cartographer

191493.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Can you put down the prison riot? Is one of your old friends wrongly imprisioned and you have to bust him out? Does the bloody paladin in your party insist you go inside to investigate the claims of a overly brutal and sadistic jailor? Are you imprisoned after the big misunderstanding of the Sherrif finding you with the corpse of the mayor? Did you really do it!? With D20 Cartographer, the story is in your hands!

Rogue's Reward Prison is the forth in a series of One Dollar Dungeon maps, which represent convenient starting locations or class-specific adventure locals for each traditional RPG character class. Rogue's Reward Prison is a poster sized prison map pack with general population cells, holding cells, gallows, and a frightening dungeon. The prison is mapped out in typical 1 in. = 5 ft. map format.

Included for your convenience are several different formats:
- Full color map in a single .jpg (versions with and without grid)
- High contrast black and white map in a single .jpg (great for printing on parchment textured paper)
- PDF of the map sliced up over multiple pages for easy printing for your home printer, compatible with US Letter and A4 size paper

D20 Cartographer also supports Virtual Table Top systems and includes:
- 100DPI gridless .jpg mapwith objects removed
- Objects in .png format for use on this map or reuse in your private maps
- An RPTools MapTool VTT file (.rpmap) with vision blocking and object layer set up for you

191494.name: GOLFun with the Animals
191494.description:
This game is intended to teach children and adults a few things about the game of golf. Players learn how to keep score, learn golf terms, and learn golf rules.

Players roll a variety of colored dice to advance a "golf ball" tiddlywink along a festive golf course board. Characters include "Hump" the camel and "Andy" the alligator. A spinner is used for putting when a player reaches the green. Score is kept according to golf rules and two options are available... nine holes or eighteen holes.

Designed to be enjoyed by 1 to 4 players ages 6 and older.

Includes a two-sided board, dice, tiddlywinks, putting wheel, score pad, rules, and a pencil.

191495.name: Ranger's Camp near the Ruins Map Pack

rpgseries.33351: One Dollar Dungeons by D20 Cartographer

191495.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Have you been waylaid on your journey through the woods? Has the rumors of mystical power emanating from the secluded ruins brought you outside the reaches of civilization? Come to find the source of the troll infestation in the forest? Has your camp been ambushed at night, your party caught sleeping in their tents, unawares? With D20 Cartographer, the story is in your hands!

Ranger's Camp near the Ruins is the fifth in a series of One Dollar Dungeons maps, which represent convenient starting locations or class-specific adventure locals for each traditional RPG character class. Ranger's Camp is a giant 48x36 map (two poster's worth!). It includes a simple camp nestled under a ridge on the forest floor, a generic forested wilderness map, a simple dirt road passing through the woods, and stone ruins with two levels: one stone platform nestled amidst trees and a dark, below-ground basement level. Everything is mapped out in typical 1 in. = 5 ft. map format.

Included for your convenience are several different formats including:
• Each 4 component maps in individual .jpg (versions with and without grid)
• High contrast black and white map in a single .jpg (great for printing on parchment textured paper)
• Legal and A4-sized PDFs of the sliced images for your home printer

D20 Cartographer also supports Virtual Table Top systems and includes:
• An object file folder with png objects for use in this map or reuse in other Virtual Table Top Maps
• A MapTools .rpmap VTT file with vision blocking and objects set up for you

191496.name: Warlord's Watchtower Map Pack

rpgseries.33351: One Dollar Dungeons by D20 Cartographer

191496.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Is it up to you to put and end to the dispotic rule of the warlord and his trained garrison? Is the hillfort under siege by the undead and your party has been broughtin as extra hired muscle? Has the emperor's brother gone into hiding in the secluded watchtower, fearing assassins sent by the mad ruler? Are you there to protect him, or are you the assassin? With D20 Cartographer, the story is in your hands!

Warlord's Watchtower is the sixth in a series of One Dollar Dungeon maps, which represent convenient starting locations or class-specific adventure locals for each traditional RPG character class. The Warlord's Watchtower is a compact fort with a five story attached watchtower! The structure is mapped out in typical 1 in. = 5 ft. map format.
Included for your convenience are several different formats including:

• Full color map in a single .jpg (versions with and without grid)
• High contrast black and white map in a single .jpg (great for printing on parchment textured paper)
• Legal and A4-sized PDFs of the 'sliced images' (into 7x7 tiles) for printing on your home printer
D20 Cartographer also supports Virtual Table Top systems and includes:

• 100DPI gridless .jpg with objects removed
• An object file folder with over 35 .png objects for private reuse in other maps
• A MapTools .rpmap VTT file with vision blocking and objects set up for you. The Maptools file requires version 1.3b84 or higher to work.

191497.name: Paladin's Secluded Citadel Map Pack

rpgseries.33351: One Dollar Dungeons by D20 Cartographer

191497.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Is this the starting point for your Paladin's crusade, or will it be the bloody ending? Have you come to spread your god's message in a foreign land, or are you defending against the savage heathen invaders? Will this sanctuary that's stood in the desert for generations serve as a base for your new mission? With D20 Cartographer, the story is in your hands!

Paladin's Secluded Citadel is the seventh in a series of One Dollar Dungeon maps, which represent convenient starting locations or class-specific adventure locals for each traditional RPG character class. Paladin's Secluded Citadel is an onion-domed fort in the desert with an Arabian Nights flavor: a perfect setting for crusaders! Three stories tall and a rooftop level, the citadel fort is mapped out in typical 1 in. = 5 ft. map format.
Included for your convenience are several different formats including:

• Full color map in a single .jpg (versions with and without grid)
• High contrast black and white map in a single .jpg (great for printing on parchment textured paper)
• PDF of the sliced images for your home printer, compatible with US Letter and A4 size paper
D20 Cartographer also supports Virtual Table Top systems and includes:

• 100DPI gridless .jpg with objects removed
• An object file folder with over 18 new .png objects for private reuse in other maps
• A MapTools .rpmap VTT file with vision blocking and objects set up for you. The Maptools file requires version 1.3b84 or higher to work.

Print Guide for the sliced PDF: When printing in Adobe Acrobat, remember to turn ‘page scaling' to ‘None' and uncheck ‘Choose paper source by PDF page size.' This will ensure the appropriate size and scale of the map and 1-inch grid. Previously, we released a separate A4 and US Letter file. This version and printing practice now prints properly to any page size.

191498.name: Warlock's Wicked Warrens Map Pack

rpgseries.33351: One Dollar Dungeons by D20 Cartographer

191498.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Have the Warlocks that dwell within this mountainside taken prisoners from the nearby town? Does the blood-magic they practice threaten to summon a dark power from the depths of hell? Have you come to put an end to the human sacrifice? Have the magicians that once lived here vanished all at once, leaving you to find the source of their disappearance? With D20 Cartographer, the story is in your hands!

Warlock's Wicked Warrens is the eighth and final release in the series of One Dollar Dungeons maps, which represent convenient starting locations or class-specific adventure locals for each traditional RPG character class. Warlock's Wicked Warrens is a large and detailed dungeon carved into a mountainside, featuring narrow corridors and massive rooms ripe for strategic combat! The structure is mapped out in typical 1 in. = 5 ft. map format.
Included for your convenience are several different formats including:

• Full color map in a single .jpg (versions with and without grid)
• High contrast black and white map in a single .jpg (great for printing on parchment textured paper)
• PDF of the sliced images for your home printer, compatible with US Letter and A4 size paper
D20 Cartographer also supports Virtual Table Top systems and includes:

• 100DPI gridless .jpg with objects removed
• An object file folder with over 35 new .png objects for private reuse in other maps
• A MapTools .rpmap VTT file with light, vision blocking, and objects set up for you. The Maptools file requires version 1.3b84 or higher to work.

Print Guide for the sliced PDF: When printing in Adobe Acrobat, remember to turn ‘page scaling' to ‘None' and uncheck ‘Choose paper source by PDF page size.' This will ensure the appropriate size and scale of the map and 1-inch grid. Previously, we released a separate A4 and US Letter file. This version and printing practice now prints properly to any page size.

191499.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Townscapes are simple, generic maps of typical locations you might find in any medieval or fantasy towns. They are meant to fill in the gaps and provide easy to print maps for excepted or unexpected encounters. They are mapped out in typical 1 in. = 5 ft. map format.

Townscapes: Blacksmith Map is a one-page map of a simple, small-town blacksmtih's workshop and home for your party to patronize, rob, or rumble in!

Full color map in a single .jpg (versions with and without grid)

Legal and A4-sized PDFs for printing on your home printer
